text: Thank you yelp!!! I am so glad I found this little market.  Perfect place to find all the middle eastern spices I need for cooking.  The restaurant inside has amazing food.  Just perfect for my random kabob cravings.  The KGB is to die for!!! Two juicy koobideh kabobs on a big flat bread with onions, grilled tomato, and a ton of fresh basil($9.99 ).  I noticed when I dined in the food was on the slower side of coming out.  I prefer ordering ahead and picking up.  Mmm can't wait to be back!

Great food, great service and great people working here. I do most of my shopping here and it's much more pleasant than going to some big grocery store and standing in line. The restaurant inside is also amazing and probably has the best rice out of any Mediterranean restaurant I've tried. 5 stars well deserved!
Great little restaurant and a nice market. I come here for lunch and always have great experience.

My wife was craving hummus and Mediterranean food. After a little research, we stumbled upon this delightful Persian market and deli. We ordered hummus (of course), a falafel sandwich, and the chicken soltani (combo of chicken and koobideh kabobs). The hummus came with sesame flat bread which was nice and flaky and served fresh out of the oven. The falafel was tasty and the kabobs were well marinated and served on a bed of basmati rice. We wanted to try dessert but were too full this time around. Delicious food combined with reasonable prices and efficient service with a smile makes Zaytoon a winner in our book. We will be back to this neighborhood gem.

Love the beef and chicken koobideh and the lavash freshly made and hot! When you walk in you feel the warm inviting atmosphere and the feeling of feeling welcome to a family. Their fresh juices made to order are delicious. The lady is who served us was very accommodating, friendly, and makes sure that we receive the food HOT. I can't stand it when we eat out and the food is room temp or almost cold. We have been here several times now and the food is always fresh and the service is friendly. They don't make you feel rushed. Their fragrant hot tea is wonderful and I feel I can linger without feeling rushed out. I also like their market that's connected, they have such a wide variety of things that come from many countries, their selection is extensive. I even like their fresh herbs, cheese, and variety of fruits. Love this place!

I was impressed with this place for taste(it hit the spot) and the price which was way too cheap for all you get, I ordered the bone in chicken kabob plus two extra beef kabobs which ran me about $20, my wife had a boneless chicken kabob plus the dill flavored rice for about $13, which she thoroughly enjoyed too, I was in Persian food heaven minus the virgins.  Gotta sprinkle the roasted lemon flakes on the white rice with saffron, winner! Place is really small, with like 7 tables and is located inside a Middle eastern market which was rather interesting in a good way. So if your visiting Vegas, come check it out, we have nothing like this in Hawaii which really sucks.

Once again, this place doesn't disappoint. Stopped by Vegas and we had to eat here again.

Their food is fresh. Meat dishes are juicy and flavorful. The hummus and bread are perfect together. They are consistent and I highly recommend this place.
A super cozy family owned restaurant. Food is very delicious and freshly made. Customer service is beyond expectations. Will definitely return!

In the words of LMFAO, all I can say is "you're my new obsession". My sister and I stumbled upon Zaytoon during our summer trip to Vegas. We had been driving around aimlessly looking for something to eat and then BAM, came across this place. Actually, I don't remember how we found it. I just remember we wanted to get our grub on. We went in and perused the market area. I was hoping to find some cool knick-knacks or other rarities since I hardly ever go to Middle Eastern markets. I didn't find anything that I really wanted to get but my sister got a few food items. They carry some flip flops and some evil eye looking jewelry but I'm pretty particular about what brand of flip flops I wear and definitely am not into evil eye jewelry. 

I decided to go to the restaurant next door, which isn't really next door since it's only partitioned by a screen or something. I ordered two beef sandwiches a.k.a. Koobideh Kabobs wrapped in lavash bread, which cost $7.99 each. You have the option of choosing a Shirazi Salad or french fries so I got the salad for myself and the fries for my stepdad. My sister decided not to get something from here but went to Long John Silvers instead and she regrets that choice to this day. Hahahah. 

Anyway, the food was sooo good that when I came back to Vegas last week I found myself craving it and wanting it. We finally came to Zaytoon on our last day here to have a proper lunch before setting out for L.A. It was just as good as I remembered and the Masto Khiar (cucumber and yogurt) was so creamy and thick. A lot of the other ones I've had before were just plain runny and blah. I ordered the same thing again since I wanted to take half my sandwich for the road and it's a lot easier to eat a sandwich in the car than a box of basmati rice! It's a shame I didn't get a dessert but I got a yummy mint flavored yogurt soda. I couldn't really taste the mint and the uncarbonated version definitely tastes much more minty, but it's all good. My sisters also really enjoyed what they ordered. One of them ordered the same thing I got but with avocado slices and the other one got the Chicken Kabob plate. 

The service was also great. There was just one person working at the time we got here. He was youngish and very attentive. He was also very cordial and polite. He showed me how to mix the yogurt soda and how to open it since there's a trick to opening it. If you don't open it properly, which equates to opening it very slowly then you may end up with it all over your shirt.

Zaytoon is one place that I look forward to going back to the next time I'm in Vegas. Perhaps, I'll go back multiple times if time and my funds permit just to try other stuff. It's affordable, convenient, and the food is just plain good. Now if only I could find a place reminiscent of it back home.

Was excellent and so tasty 
Friendly , small but the adjoining grocery is worth a visit after a meal .
One of the best restaurants in Vegas and the best meat in town great people great service great food
So good!I have been preaching this place to my friends. Affordable, good service, fast table times, and a good clean meal. Will return again and again!

Soooo good was there the other day with grandma & she loved it! Service and food is always consistent, homemade, family owned/ operated.  The best Persian food in Vegas by far! Thanks Zaytoons for the friendly service, keep the great food coming:)

The bottom line: We are definitely fans of Iranian food and Zaytoon did not disappoint us.

The Pros: The service was very friendly and our server was quite knowledgeable. I once got a tip to always try the daily stew in an Iranian restaurant and Zaytoon's pomegranate stew was no disappointment. The price was reasonable. The variety was very good. We loved the fact that they had "sumak" as a condiment on the tables and that the other diners were quite obviously Middle-Eastern. The market that is adjacent to the restaurant has a large variety of Middle-Eastern products that we have been looking for for quite a while.

The Cons: The location is not necessarily the first you would think of if you are a tourist in Las Vegas. The setup is very "family style" which we really like, but others may not find "professional" enough.

Best Mediterranean food in vegas!  It's always a good idea and never disappoints!  Chicken kabobs are super tasty and everything is always good!  When I come to vegas this is my first stop! My family loves it!!
love their food and pear/ginger juice! great service and always consistent

Wowzer this place is awesome! I would recommend this place to anyone. The food is phenomenal, and the staff super attentive and nice. Very friendly environment and clean, I'll be coming to eat here very often. There is even a very nice market right inside. This place won't disappoint you!

I like this family owned Mediterranean market.  The herbs are always fresh & crisp and they also have plenty of packet seasoning available.  Their prices are comparable to that of Jones Market, however some items are a bit more reasonable here.  The girl that helped me in today's visit was very nice and helpful so I appreciate that customer service.

This is absolutely amazing food. I would go back to Las Vegas just to eat here. I am vegetarian and there was a good choice for us vegetarians. Dishes that might be ordinary anywhere else are sublime here. And as others have noted, the service is excellent. 
The TV plays culturally relevant programming. It played quietly enough to allow normal conversation.

Wonderful food. Wonderful service. Stopped here on vacation and it did not disappoint.  It was by far the best persian food i had in the states. Casual ambiance. Seemed like cheers where everyone knows each other.

A great Persian restaurant in Las Vegas. I have been here many times and always had great quality food. I am a big fan of Persian food in general and was so happy to find this place. It is about 15 minutes away from the crazy strip area so it was great for me because I was able to check out a different side of Vegas and more of a local area. Anyways the food always came very well made and the portions were generous. Definitely will be a returning customer next time I am on Vegas.

Had dinner here last Friday night with my family from The Bay Area. The food was really good and my cousins said it was better than a lot of places they eat at in SF. The market area has good options for you to taste the desserts and chocolates. Will for sure go here again.
Small whole in the wall kind of place. Food is excellent and taste is consistent. Their kornish hen is the best I have ever tried. The owners are very polite and courteous.

Just went there for dinner. Got to try their Koobideh kabob, it came with some sort of flatbread which I was not aware of, it tasted so good! The dish came with two beef kabobs that were unbelievably juicy, an onion basil salad, and rice with a burnt tomato on the side. Overall the dish tasted good, but this was my first time to eat mediteranean here in the US so I wasn't so sure about that.

I will explore other mediteranean spots as well and this restaurant will serve as my benchmark.

This place is the best persian restaurant whole US . They really should charge more for their food--you can tell they put a lot of work in making it so tasty, especially the kababs, which is crazy flavorful.
Service was friendly but slow. Also, food wasn't that good. Overall, it is an average place to dine at.
Fantastic food great service and the bread is amazing many of lunches and not enough dinners spent here.

First of all the environment is so warm and welcoming. It's a family run business and it shows in every aspect. When I left I felt as though I was apart of the family. The service was EXCELLENT.:.Very fast and attentive. Now on to the food..... Holy YUM!!! (My mouth is watering just thinking of it).. Anyways, The beef koobideh is the best I have ever had, and the Persian chicken salad with the homemade bread (which by the way is hot, fresh, and TO DIE FOR) is a must have. If you are in the area I recommend stopping by for a flavorful and authentic Persian meal, and I guarantee you will leave full and extremely satisfied.

This is one of my favorite places in Vegas.  The food is just spectacular and the service is extremely friendly.  The baba ghanoush is the best I have ever had.  I also really like the koobideh kobab.  Try it with the special spicy sauce they have and it is just out of this world.  I have been there a few times and it has been consistently great each time.  I cannot recommend it highly enough.

I just moved to the area and found this restaurant on Yelp's eat24. Ordering online is super easy. Food was ready right on time for pickup. Plenty of parking at their location. Food is delicious, healthy and a great value! Customer service is amazing! On my third order, I instructed the restaurant to exclude pita breads from my order since my family and I are avoiding gluten and didn't want to waste the pita breads. When I picked up my order, they told me that since we can't eat pita breads, they gave us a container of freshly sliced cucumbers instead. Wow! It's such a kind, thoughtful and generous thing to do for a customer! I was so impressed! They have a customer for life! These people know how to treat a customer.

This is the closest to my friend's homemade Persian food I've found in Vegas to date! Delicious! My daughter and I will be regulars here for sure. Told  the owner he's stuck with us! Very friendly service and fast. Food was, again, DELICIOUS and hot. Hummus, bread, basmati rice and kubideh is spectacular!
I tried this place and I'll never come again. I ordered barg, it was cut very thin and dry the kabob was just ok. The price is a bit pricey.
The best Persian restaurant in Vegas. They have authentic good food, good prices and most importantly a very good family who owns it. Try it and you won't regret going there.

The food was absolutely awesome !!
I have a  5 years old daughter which she does not like meat we did order 
KABAB barg and kobedeh. She finished 
One KABAB barg by herself and she loves it. I recommend this place for sure
Great food, awesome service, clean place, everything you need of a Persian meat, cheese, vegetable, candies, spices and can produce.

I stumbled across this place in a search for Douwe Egberts coffee, which is hands down the best coffee on Earth.  It showed up on their menu and rather than just popping into a Mediterranean place for a cup of coffee on a hot Spring day, which would be a bit weird, my wife and I went for dinner.

It's not an overly large place by any means, but there was no wait to sit and service was prompt.  Feeling adventurous, my wife ordered the Yogurt Soda.  The gentleman helping us was nice enough to double check if we knew what it was because too many people come in to try new things and end up paying for a soda they don't drink.  We ended up enjoying the soda, even if it tasted like salty liquid yogurt dip.

Foodwise, we started with the cucumber and yogurt dip.  The bread comes out perfectly crispy and its flavor complements the dip.  For the main courses, I settled on the KGB and my wife got the Fesenjaan.  The waiter was nice enough to let me know how to properly eat my meal - it's a bit daunting if you have no idea how to go about it!  

Both entrees were delicious.

After dinner, we moved on to the main reason we had found Zaytoon - the coffee.  We paired it with the pistachio/rose/saffron ice cream.  The ice cream was good, but not mind-blowing.  The coffee was as smooth as expected.

The service was wonderful.  They make you feel at home.  Everyone was very engaging and friendly.

After our meal, we got up and walked around the attached market, which contained enough unique wares that we spent more money in there.  Overall, it was a great dining experience.  My only complaint is that it's so far from where we live in Henderson.
Amazing food here. The bread is to die for. The special dishes and any Kebob are/is fresh and flavorful.

The bone in chicken was good, nicely seasoned and very juice. But was just missing something maybe a sauce. A Nice sauce would have made this meal so much better. I miss kabob Palace. where they had a great sauce for there kabobs called chutney specifically for there meats.

Amazing food!! This place is like our second home! Service is great! People are very friendly. Love everything in the menu! My favorite appetizer is the eggplant dip with fresh mint and kashk  on top. For entree I really like the wraps. The grilled, bone in chicken Kabob is to die for. I love their freshly made breads, fresh squeezed juices. Everything is Healthy tasty and simple!

This is a cute little family business that's tucked away in a quiet Las Vegas neighborhood. I met the owner and his daughter and they were super sweet and passionate about their cooking. The food was amazing. I went with my parents and everything we had was very flavorful and fresh. Collectively, we tried the kashke bademjaan, the lamb shanks, and the chicken soltani. The meat was very moist and tender! The bread and the rice were heavenly! 

Also, for all the mideasterns in the area, you can get your essentials here! They got everything from spices to shishas!

I'm middle eastern and I think that I couldn't give any middle Easter place a 5 star rating. But it was delicious! We ordered delivery through bite squad and it was so good! However if you have left overs the food doesn't stay very well. It gets soggy and flavors dissipate. But still decent. I will definitely be eating here again.

I just want to say thanks to Yelp for helping us find this oasis in the desert of Las Vegas!! You will not be disappointed with the food or service here. This is now our regular Persian food spot in Las Vegas. Only downside is they are located a bit of the way from the strip. Since we are always visiting from San Diego we generally stay on the strip. But worth the trip anytime!!! Great service too..
My favorite Persian restaurant! The owners are so nice and the food is mouth watering!

Overall nice place and pretty nice staff too. Went in today because I was craving falafel, the food was just okay. Nothing too special about it at all. I've had way better falafel at way better prices too and I was expecting it to be better considering all the good reviews.

My falafel was absolutely delicious. I really liked the bread they serve before my meal. The rice was perfection with the seasonings that were added.  The fries were definitely worth it. The service was impeccable. I found a new fave!  So happy I found this place!
The best food ever!!! If you are looking for Persian deliciousness this is the right place to find it. Kabob is melting on your mouth!!!

This place is amazing!! I love coming to this place because every one is very nice and they treat you like family. The food is great especially the kubideh and their warm bread. Their Persian tea is very good as well. The first time me and my daughter came to this place we were treated very well and accomodation is phenomenal. Ever since then we  have been coming to this place every other 2 days to satisfy our cravings. We would not go to any other Persian restaurant but this place only.  I gave this place 100% five star and beyond!!!
We really enjoyed the food!  We especially like the friendly Sam!  Thank you very much!  We'll be back!  God bless!  Carmen, Lola & Carlos

Great authentic Persian restaurant with a very friendly staff.  We had the chicken kabobs and meat kabobs, both were great and very reasonably priced.  Thanks Saamy!  You are the best - we will see you guys soon.

I've been here many times before and never disappointed.. I'm not from the area, but every time I come to Vegas I have to stop by for some of the great food they serve. Don't let the location fool you, come by for some great middle eastern food. Thanks zaytoon ' s for another amazing meal! See you guys the next time I'm here in sin city.

This place has great food and excellent service.  I enjoy coming here they treat you like family and their food always taste fresh.  I have been eating here for a while but they really deserve good credit for their food.  Must come if you feel like home cooked meal.

Trying new food is exciting to me. Went here with my owner doctor and co workers. He's Persian and were warmly greeted and seated immediately. Looking around...it was inviting and cozy.  It almost felt like i was in someone's kitchen. We had sone type of eggplant which i wasn't crazy about. It was bitter and not tasty. Ordered the chicken salimi i believe that's what it's called. It was chicken, beef and Jasmine rice. Sounds pretty plain but it was tasty. I'll try anything once. We had great service, excellent company and the food was ok for me. I may not go out of my way to go here but I'll stop by if I'm in the area again.
Really good spot for Persian food. I always get the beef koobideh. So delish! Love the rice that is served with it too. I've tried the chicken kabobs and they're not too bad either.
Excellent food!  Great quality and wonderful service.  Chicken was seasoned perfectly!  The shirazi salad was refreshing and tasty!  Can only say good things about this place!
Fresh and tasty food, always! Charming staff and great customer service! Support our neighborhood businesses! These people deserve it. :)

Decided to check this place out based on other yelp reviews and glad that I did!  Don't let the strip mall location fool you . The food and service are on point here. The dining area is small but just big enough that you're not on top of adjacent tables and connects through to a full middle eastern market.  The lavash bread was freshly made and perfectly chewy and crispy.  The chicken and ground beef skewers were tender and flavorful.  Would definitely come back to try their other specialties!

The owners are super friendly and the food is amazing. The chicken kabobs are probably the best marinated chicken I've ever had. Mix in the hummus with their flat bread, and you have a value meal that's healthy and so so tasty! Highly recommend.

Really good place for Persian food... Koobideh and rice is delicious... Eggplant ist good... Together with some warm bread - yummy 
For me the best Persian food I had here in Vegas... Since iam used to the Persian food in Germany and in LA it was really hard to find a place with good Persian food here. 

You have to go and try it...
In Vegas for a conference, missing good nyc foood.  This place is awesome, good and customer service is exceptional
The food was awesome and the prices were cheaper then expected. I had the Ghourmeh Sabzi.  It was delicious!

Coming from a Persian household, I can say I am pretty good at distinguishing what's good and bad, for Persian food. This is hands down one of the best Persian restaurants I've been to in America. A family friend in California told me about this place, and I decided to come down today, just to refresh my memory of the city, and try this place out. Very impressed, and next time I'm in town, this will be my go-to spot!!

Sturgeon!  Never would have guessed you can get this here (it's the most expensive item on the menu at $20).  Many vegetarian choices.  They go heavy with herbs and spices, which is what you should get at a Persian restaurant.  I don't eat meat, but would expect the kabobs are good.  Watermelon juice is made fresh there; they go to the market section of the store, and juice a fresh watermelon.  The interior is clean, and they don't pack the tables too close together.  Our waiter was friendly and courteous.  It took a few minutes longer than expected to prepare the meal, so don't be in a hurry.  The spinach soup with lentils was superb.

Very nice, for the most part.  Not at all fancy, the restaurant is just a portion of the grocery store.  The staff were very friendly and the food was good.  I have definitely had better, but only at much nicer (& more expensive) places.  This was very nice.  The rice was fluffy and delicious, and my Chicken Kabob was delicious - all white meat, nicely marinated.  I would definitely go there again.

Zytoon is the best Iranian Restaurant in Town. The food is delicious, the  atmosphere is refreshing and peaceful. Golenaz and Sam are great and make you feel at home. I recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants to taste Persian/ Mediterranean food. Don't miss it!!!

This restaurant has the best food and a wonderful warm atmosphere. The owner and staff are warm and friendly -- great people! I love the quotes on the walls. It is a quaint place, less than a dozen tables, so you won't be treated like it's a franchise. I go there almost once a week. I highly recommend it to everyone.

Fantastic!  I am the stereotypical American white boy, but have loved this style food for most of my life.  I was looking for a place to buy sumac...not only did I find it, but I also got a great meal to-go.  Sam, the owner, was welcoming and exceptionally friendly...he even gave me some of their amazing hot tea and Barbari (maybe not the right term, but it was some awesome house-made flat bread).  I have eaten Persian food since I was a kid in the DC area, and I miss all the choices, flavors and great places I would eat with my friends growing up.  I will be back to shop at their store and eat from their kitchen.  The shelves had so many items I will buy, just to "try" because they are items we would not normally find in our local grocery stores.  It's boring to try the items we already buy everyday, surprise yourself and you may find some delicious new tastes.

One of my favorite Mediterranean markets / restaurants in Las Vegas and I've been to a lot to say the least.  Being Middle Eastern myself, I find it extremely difficult to find a place that even compares to my mothers cooking.  Unfortunately my mom lives in California so I don't get to eat her food as often as I would like therefore I am very thankful for Zaytoon!  It's clean, fresh and very delicious.  This is always our number one choice when my boyfriend and I are craving some tasty Mediterranean food.

If you haven't tried this place, you're seriously missing out.  Quick warning: You may get addicted and after you eat here, no other middle eastern restaurant will taste as good.
My boyfriend and I love this place! The hummus and flat bread is my favorite here! It's a very "ma and pa" place, which we love!
Omg! First time here trying some persian food ordered the shirazi salad and the koobideh kabobs everything was delicious and fresh the service was exceptional ... Will come back

Unbelievably good!  The flatbread with light and dark sesame seeds was toasted perfectly and is probably the best bread I've ever eaten in my life.

Everything else was good also, especially the Shikara salad (mint, diced cucumber).
All of the appetizers are great.  Hell, everything was great.

Give this place a try, you won't be disappointed.

My office has ordered from Zaytoons twice now. Both orders are very large (usually 13 to 15 items total with each item having 4 to 8 servings of 4 to 6 main dishes and 2 to 3 servings of various side items each time). While it's a bit difficult to go get so much food ourselves, we are so happy with this place that we continue to do just that. Everything we have ordered to date has been hot, flavorful, cooked well and just heaven to your tastebuds. We have had the Barg, Chicken, Cornish, Lamb and Veggie kabobs each time we have ordered and they all have been flavorful, juicy and cooked just perfect. The rice is a mixture of Tumeric and white basmati. It is cooked perfectly (no underdone pieces to crunch on while you are eating like in some places) and has a ton of flavor. I can't say enough about the bread other than you get a piece larger than your plate that is crispy and fluffy all in the same piece. The best of both worlds. You can't go wrong ordering from here.
Love this place and the folks that were working are so friendly! The food was amazing and the atmosphere was quaint. Perfect lunch spot! Couldn't leave without getting a sweet treat!

The best kabob in town. I tried zaytoon for the first time about 3 weeks ago and since then I go there at least 2-3 times a week. The food is delicious, the service is excellent, and the place is very nice, clean and neat. Recommend Zaytoon to everyone.

This place is amazing! 
Chicken kabobs are a must get.
Chicken is cooked to perfection & the staff are always very welcoming they treat you like family!
In my opinion they have the best Persian food in the city beside of a warm and friendly staff.

My favorite place to eat in Vegas.  Nice family owned restaurant. The food is amazing and fresh all the time. I'm having withdrawals now for the food. You need to expand to the northwest I can assure you it will be the busiest place around. Teach these other amateur restaurants a thing or two.  Keep up the good work !!!

Mom and Pop operation with a Persian Grocery store adjacent to the restaurant. They have the best and juiciest Beef Koobideh in town. Their oven baked bread is a must with the Yogurt and Shallot side.
They also serve fresh squeezed juices, which is a bonus. Polite service and casual environment makes for a very satisfying meal!
Amazing food. Definitely, the best hummus I've ever  eaten Fast, friendly service. They made us feel like part of the family. We loved it!
Love this place. The food is out of this world. And the customer service is the best, great job.
Every single dish we ordered was fantastic! We will be back every time we're in Las Vegas.

Although I've never had Persian food in Iran I have had it many places across the US. As many have mentioned it's a family run place, half grocery and half market. It's more than comfortable enough and made even more so by the gracious hosts and the food which I can only classify as comfort food. Wonderful freshly baked flatbread, very good hummus and possibly the best Koobideh I've had. After numerous trips we've yet to be disappointed.

After coming here for the past few years, they had recently started doing online orders. The last two times, I had ordered through yelp. Very fast and convenient. After order submission, they receive the order within a few seconds (it goes to a timer so literally it is a few seconds lol) then it tells you about how long it takes to be ready. 

For the last two times, they have been really fast and had the order completed within 10-15 minutes. I almost feel like they are even faster than they are IN the restaurant ! LOL 

Pretty big order. Comes with the usual sides of sliced onions, a thing of butter, a roasted tomato, a huge amount of rice and of course 2 skewers of koobideh. My favorite item and have always and only got this xD It comes with a packet of Sumac which is a great dry spice/seasoning which gives a nice tart/bright flavor to everything. 

Because the rice is not completely all turmeric cooked rice, they had mixed a lot of white rice with it. The last time I had put on a packet of white sauce from Halal guys and mixed it all up. It was yummy XD

Ok now we talking flavor!  This place was recommended to me a friend.  It's a restaurant and grocery store together.  Interesting part is that the grocery store is completely Israeli and the restaurant serves halal food.  It's nice to see that. Now food...excellent beef kabob n kobideh. 
I would avoid the lamb. 
Give this place a try.

I love this place. The food is great and I love the market. I only wish they had more tables inside for patrons. They are so popular that waiting for a table is normal for this place. I guess all good things come to those who wait. It's definitely worth the wait.

Hey morning glory, what's the story? I've been told that this is one of the best spots for Mediterranean food in Vegas. After trying it out one night, I can't say for a fact that this is true. In fact, I would have to argue that it would not be on my list for best spots for Mediterranean food in Vegas. I thought all the food was about A-OK here.

So some peeps, (and I won't mention who because you know who you are, I hope that you do) told me that Zaytoon was the place to go for some of the best Mediterranean food in town. I was really excited to come here. I thought that this place would change the whole game. You know, a game-changer. Well, the opportunity presented itself to me, in a way that you could understand, but I would still like to keep that a secret, unless you know what it is, then it's fine. But, I don't think you do, or do you? That is in and of itself, the mystery. You could even say its a mysterization of magnanimous malfunctions. Or else.

Well, so came the day when the anticipation would end. Came here on a Dark Knight. It wasn't cloudy as of yet, but I needed my blinkers on in order to see the world from the outside. Zaytoon is a small place, a little cafe connected to a market. Few tables, here and there, bada bing, bada boom, sitting down. Menu? Simple, little confusing with the combos and the non's. Ordered the Kabob of Chicken combo. Waited.

Little complimentary cracker came out. Dusted with seeds. Put it on with the butter. It was OK. Kinda a cross between. Time was ticking. Into the future. Fly like a eagle to the sea. Fly like a eagle, let my spirit carry me. Oh, forgot about the review. Back to it. 

Chicken Kabob combo - White and yellow rice. Needed to put a hellalotta salt on it. Shaking it like a British nanny. Also had to put on the spice on it. Red spice. The Spice of Life. Life giveth. Life taketh. Wish there was something more to it, lacked a lot. Chicken? Cooked alright. Breast meat. Wasn't dry. Still, needed the salt. A lot of it. Dumped the red spice on it. Couldn't figure out where the flavor went. Looking underneath the table for it. Had to take out the gyroscope. CSI Las Vegas. 

Prob won't come here. Game has changed to much. The options are unlimited. And so am I. Got my faves. Gonna look around. It's out there. Just gotta look some more. Murder mystery. Clue. I'll pick the top hat. Do not pass Go. Amen.
I simply love this place. The food is great and authentic. The market has great products and serves the customers needs to a tee. I love the family atmosphere of the staff.
This placer is outstanding,  food was so good and the service was super!  I definitely will be back
delicious! the food and service were excellent. The staff was very friendly and accomidating.

I love this place.  The hummus is so perfect.  I think it is best for take out as opposed to eat in-- as a eat in place it seems like the table and chairs are just in the middle of a grcery store.  But the food is amazing!
Food is awesome.  Everything was delicious.  The only thing is the price.  You get very little meat with each entr√©e making this quite expensive.

Love this place, very good customer service and food was GREAT! We always order Baba ghanoush for appetizer. Its a small family restaurant and connected to a grocery. Owner is very friendly. Their hot tea also is good and a must try.

I had the Zoltini, a combination plate of filet and ground beef kabobs. My wife and I shared an order of hummus as well.

The hummus was excellent! I wish that there had been more of it on the plate. The pita bread they brought out was extremely hot, and right out of the oven. It was also great. We ate it all super fast, and considered ordering a second plate of hummus while we waited.

The Zoltini was pretty good! The meat was well seasoned, and the well cooked. My only problem with this dish was the texture. Tastes good but a little...the closest words I can use are "mushy" and "grainy", but those sound way worse than it was. I mean, I'm giving this place 4 stars! The texture was just not what I expected I guess, or was not my preference. I have no complaints about the rice on the side. I ate all of it, and it was good.

I would definitely come here again! The menu is full of more things I want to try and the staff was helpful and friendly. The service was fast and the food was good.

Update: I still come here often and consider it one of the best Iranian places in Vegas!!
I discovered this place through an Iranian medical rep. Located in one corner of an Iranian grocery store it is run by family members. A husband and wife team Sam & Golenaz, run the restaurant. They have authentic Iranian food with exceptionally good HUMMUS (for those who like spicy, pair it with their hot sauce made of chili flakes in hot oil). All the items are made with care, are fresh and served personally by the owners. They come to check on you frequently and clearly take pride in their establishment. 
A huge plus is the fact that they also serve FRESH FRUIT JUICES!!

They also have a big variety of Turkish, Greek and Iranian Desserts.

PLEASE NOTE: Be aware that they DO NOT ACCEPT ANY CREDIT CARDS. Cash or Debit Cards are accepted.
They also DO NOT ALLOW SPLIT CHECKS.

Awesome food! Great quality and very friendly environment!
There is a grocery store in there as well which makes it one stop kind of shop.
You all should try their barg kabob.

This place ROCKS.  Found it through Groupon and even though we didn't buy the actual Groupon, they gave us the $10 off.  The restaurant is small and attached to a market and is pretty quiet.  Service is quick and friendly, prices are fair and the food is seriously yummy.  I've had better hummus before, but it's still really good.  All of their kabos and rice are super tasty and cooked and seasoned to perfection.  I have nothing to bad say about Zaytoon!  If it was closer to my house, I'd go here every week.

We just moved here from Los Angeles - where there are so many Iranian restaurants to chose from. But, this is hands down, the  most delicious kabob and baklava I've ever had. The server was so fast, courteous, and nice. We'll be back every week!

I've been coming here for years. Service had always been excellent! Very friendly owner. Everything we ordered here has been outstanding! I have tried every Mediterranean restaurant in Vegas- literally. This is the best! Love the rice, bread, koobideh, chicken, and tonight we tried the lamb shank and pomegranate walnut chicken. Perfection.

This place is soooo good! By far one of my favorite Persian restaurants in Vegas. The chicken kabob is so delicious. The chicken is not dry like in most places, they keep it nice & juicy. The eggplant dip (kashk) sooo good too my goodness. My boyfriend & I order from here almost every week. I never get sick of it.

Zaytoon is arguably the best Persian restaurant in Las Vegas. The atmosphere is quaint and charming. The family that runs the restaurant is personable and remarkably attentive. Their bread served with the mast o khiar is sensational. The meat (beef and chicken) is flavorful and served with an ample amount of delicious rice. I have been away from Las Vegas for nearly a year and have had my share of encounters with bad Persian restaurants throughout the country. I look forward to my return in the near future to make up for lost time.

Girlfriend and I came to eat and it was Good food, clean place and nice staff. I love that they have the Mediterranean groceries next to sitting area but separated enough where you are not bothered by the shoppers while eating. We also did a walk through the store and bought few things. This will be my go to spot every time I'm in Vegas. Thank you for the delicious food.
Good food. Great grocery next door. Highly recommended.

When it comes to Persian food, I'd like to think that I'm an expert! In search of the perfect Persian restaurant to have dinner at, I came across Zaytoon restaurant and I'm so glad that I did.

The interesting thing about this restaurant is that it's actually part of a Middle Eastern grocery store. We opted to walk through the grocery store on the way into the restaurant, and believe me it's nothing fancy, but the food sure is!

Ordered two different types of kebabs, the salad, hummus, and it all was awesome! Service was on point, as it was kind a like being served at my uncles house.

So the next time you're looking for Persian food, and you're up for a no-frills restaurant experience, but awesome food then this is your joint!

So here's the rundown:

Satisfied? Yes

Return? Yes

Advocate? Yes
Very good kabobs.  I like chicken kabob and rice with barberries.  I like steak kabob and Kubideh too.  Price is reasonable but they charge too much for adding barberries on the rice

New to Vegas I was looking for Persian food, most of all Kabob. After living in Los Angeles I have had my fair share and know good Kabob and persian food. I decided to order Kabob and gheimeh. The kabob was good but the ghemeh was mediocre at best. The price was certainly higher than what I have paid for in the past, especially given the service and the ambiance.

This is the best Mediterranean/Persian Restaurant in all of Nevada. Connected to their market, makes shopping while you dine very convenient.

The service is outstanding!!! From the moment you walk in, to the moment you leave, you're always treated like family. A true test to this standard, is the fact that most ethnic restaurants, usually cater to mostly that ethnic culture. At Zaytoon, every time I've gone in there, there are people of all ethnic backgrounds dining and shopping. 

The market carries everything and anything you need, to prepare a authentic Mediterranean meal. Their products are of a higher standard, and are priced lower than major grocery stores. 

As mentioned earlier, their restaurant is by far the best Mediterranean/Persian Restaurant in all of Nevada! They have a complete menu, including Appetizers, Authentic and Commercial Drinks, Main Course and Desserts. 

The quality and taste of the food stands at a higher level than any of their competition. It's no competition, when it comes to price. 

They offer Dine In, Take Out, and are perfect for large parties. 

I have, and will continue to refer Zaytoon to my friends and family.

We randomly picked this place while attending a conference. We wanted a place off the strip.  Service was great!  We had lots of questions and wanted to try so many dishes. They put together a family style dinner for us so we could share. Everything was delicious.

This place was amazing. Now the best true Mediterranean food I have ever had and I'm a huge fan of medi food! The chicken was so juicy and tender and flavorful. The cucumber salad was perfect the rice was nice and fluffy even the bread they was was tasty. It came with a side of a onion salad and even that was great. I would for sure recommend this place. And come back next time I'm in the area!!! The service was amazing. Everyone was so nice and prompt

This place has "Family restaurant" written all over it.  You can tell that they care about what they serve and serve it with pride. Fresh juices, warm homemade lavash with sesame seeds, and everything is natural! This was my third trip back and I enjoyed it very much each time. I've tried their fresh carrot juice, chicken and lamb wraps and my personal favorite, Ghormeh Sabzi! I sure wish we had a place like this in Tucson. The market is great too. My wife had me pick up some saffron while I was there to bring back home!

This is a middle eastern grocery store/restaurant. I come here for their veggie kabob and it is absolutely delicious. The staff is very friendly and hospitable. They will treat you like family. Everything on the menu looks delicious, unfortunately I'm vegetarian sad to say I won't be able to try the other dishes. When my family is craving for some middle eastern Persian food this restaurant is the go-to-place. I also do some of my groceries here. They have great deals on some of the basmati rice. I am an avid tea drinker and this place is where I get fresh loose leaf tea. For dessert I always get the rose water flavored pistachios ice cream sandwich. The ice cream sandwich is light and creamy. I'll be a regular customer at zaytoons

I came here to satisfy my Persian food craving. The food was pretty tasty. I ordered the Koobideh Beef Kabob. It was cooked well, however I was hoping to have lamb meat, but I didn't see it on the menu. My mom ordered Lamb Shank. This was mediocre in my opinion, there was more fat than meat. The service was really warm and welcoming. Also this is a market so you can purchase some Persian goods. I bought some fig jam, excited to try it! Happy eating :)

This is our go to place for the perfect meal. The meals we have tried and loved are as follows:
Soltani - perfectly delicious (we usually split this and get a bunch of sides)
Boneless Chicken - no complaints there
Boneless chicken or koobideh sandwich - perfect lunch 
Mast musir, mastu khiar & hummus
Kashk bademjun is pretty good but not the best ive had
Lamb w/fava rice 
The bread is soo soo good 
Overall the best kabob in town. Haven't tried the all their specialty dishes like the ghormesabzi, but looking forward to trying it and prob wont be disappointed

What appears to be family owned Mediterranean market in a lowkey plaza. It doesn't look very appealing from the exterior but I had a lovely time. My friend and I took our seats outside of the cafe facing the parking lot. Though the scenery is nothing to rave about we started out with fresh carrot juice, twas delish! We opened with grave leaves and cucumber salad. Their cucumber salad is very sour and tangy, you must pair it with bread. Their bread is a thin crisp bread with sesame seeds. The grape leaves were decent. The eggplant with beef casserole was amazing, it's a very stew-like flavorful dish perfect over basmati rice. I ordered a side of fresh yoghurt to compliment the flavors. Overall, it was very cheap and the quality is very decent for Mediterranean food! Please be advised they do specialize in "halal" items. It is Perfect for lunch.

I like how this business is a restaurant and a grocery with a deli, but felt the menu and deli selection could use a boost.

Browsed the grocery and found both unique ethnic finds and some basic staples, which helps not have to go to multiple stores. Produce section was lacking but really liked the clear bins of refrigerated fresh herbs in the back left corner.

They were out of the koobideh so I settled for the chicken kabob plate for my dinner- surprised that this was not served with bread of any sort and their hummus was a bit on the bland side but had good texture. Chicken and rice were spot-on for doneness and flavorful, and I even enjoyed the roasted tomato.

Pricing seemed a bit steep for the setting, but I did like how effort has been put in to make the dining section visually separate from the grocery with warm beige walls and some art.

This place has unbelievable kabobs and koobideh, the flavor is so powerful that I have been driving clear across town with my family just to get my Mediterranean fix.... the owners are super nice and friendly and the quality of everything both in the restaurant and grocery is through the roof!!!!!! I strongly recommend you give this place a try because this food is a culinary treat... 5 stars all the way!!!

Zaytoon serves amazing Persian food. If you haven't tried their food yet, go do it right now lol. It is a family owned spot and they are all such humble people. I am never disappointed when eating here. Their KGB is where it's at! It's super juicy and seasoned perfectly. Their fresh bread is super addicting I usually order an extra side and dip it in their baba ganoush. I'm always so full after eating a meal from here which is always a good thing. Some items are a bit on the pricy side but always worth it!

Food 2.5. Service 3.5. The kabob is average. The rice could have been steamed more and tasted as if it had not been rinsed enough before preparing it got underway. The restaurant is essentially a partitioned section of the larger grocery store and as casual as they come (plastic plates anyone?). My picky cousins from Iran were aghast. I told them casual was in! On an up note the servers were super nice and the yogurt with shallots was right on.

Love this place! A great family owned business and a great atmosphere. The kabob plate is very generous and they have great variety of fresh juices. Also freshly made bread and always served with a smile. Support this small business!!
Eaten Here A Few Times Good Chicken Kabob

Sam you never let me down! God do I just love this place ever since I was living in Vegas I would always come here service is fantastic the barg kabob taste amazing wish this place was in sd I would always come here if it was in sd if you are Persian like me than this place will make you happy will always come here when I'm in Vegas never had a single bad experience here!

This place is so hidden. The service is friendly, but the gal forgot to give us our salad. The prices are okay and the food was not so great. The food came out in about 20 minutes from ordering, that was fine. The tea was good, but the waitress did not give any honey. The entree we ordered was lamb kabob and rice. The rice was not flavorful but it had the delicious aroma. The lamb was poorly seasoned and looked almost underdone. The only good think about this place is the somewhat good bread. Unfortunately, this is not a place that I will be returning to for Mediterranean food.

This is the first time in Vegas we came to Persian Resturant it was really good . The food was great and they have fresh bread the people they work here very very nice , we loved it we be back very soon ;) you going the enjoy the food here . Thank you
Brother and sister owned welcoming and generous service. Delicious falafel and baba ganoush

The Skinny: craving Mediterranean food - this place totally satisfies from their decadent Mushi to the Koobideh Kabob. (4) service: the owners are super friendly and food is served promptly (5),overall - it's rare to find a joint where you want to return to explore the different dishes of a culture. Zaytoon is one of those places (4.5).

I was craving hummus with some pita one day and the hubs found this place on Yelp. After that fateful night - we've been back at least 3x within the last week -- yes, it is that good.

The key dishes here IMHO are the appys (priced at $3.99 each). Our by far favs are the masto khiar (yogurt and cucumber) and the masto musir (shallot with yogurt). The yogurt itself is so thick and luscious, I bet you could turn the bowl over and not a dollop would escape. Yes it is that decadent. Paired with endless piping hot sesame topped Iranian flatbread (FYI -the owners keep the bread coming) - oh so crispy, flaky - it is definitely addicting. We've tried both the hummus and the kashe bademjaan (roasted eggplant dip) too which are both very good as well. 

I've tried their falafel and veggie sandwiches with both optional sides of the shiraz salad and fries. The sandwiches are loaded with onions, tomatoes, green peppers and cucumbers with a ?yogurt sauce and is oh so delicious. The falafel is crispy on the outside while retaining its fluffy interior. Completely satisfying.

The shiraz salad was nicely acidic to accompany the richness of the other items. Dressed with mint and citrus, the flavours of the onion, cucumber, tomato mixture really pop. The fries are okay and the portions are generous.

My hubby loves to get their chicken soltani. Both the chicken and koobedeh kabobs are well seasoned and moist. The plate comes with a roasted tomato, onions served with a bed of basmati rice. The butter and sumac on the table are used to dress the rice. 

We tried their pistachio ice cream flavoured with rosewater and saffron. Nicely floral with some cardamom mixed it, it was a nice way to finish a meal and cleanse the palate.

Every time we go there, I'm always looking around and try to see what other people are getting so we can try it next time. We saw another gentleman who ordered the koobideh kabob with fresh herbs and on fresh bread (aka KGB) which looked intriguing and has been put on our list to try the next time we are there. Not to mention there was an interesting stew they were offering over a different type of rice. The spinach soup and lamb shank sounded wonderful too.

A key factor to why we keep coming back is the service. The owners of the restaurant are really obliging and willing to take the time to explain the different dishes they offer. I was a little bit curious about their torshi - it's some form of Persian pickled vegetables. The owner actually brought some out for me to try and warned me it was an acquired taste (it was actually very good - a little bit sweet, nicely spiced --- however the hubs didn't care for it). It's really cool that they would do that.

Overall, this a great little neighbourhood joint that serves some delicious, intriguing eats for reasonable prices. Throw in the friendly service,  you have a hidden gem - not to be missed! 4.5 stars out of 5.

i love me some mediterranean food. 
so, when my friend says to me "i've been craving mediterranean food", i'm all for it.
i opened up my trusty yelp app on my phone and searched for mediterranean nearby.
zaytoon appears with a healthy 4.5 star review average across over 100 reviews and we're sold!

when we pull up, we notice that it's not just a restaurant but a market too....bonus!
we enter a small but rather full dining area which i would consider a good sign.
we were greeted immediately as i walked up to the register to take a look at the menu.
i was under the assumption that it was an order and pay first situation.
but when i told the man we were eating in, he immediately, and kindly, asked us to take a seat and he would come take our order.
so nice!

i ordered the falafel ($4) and a side of hummus with pita ($4) while my friend ordered a plate containing 2 giant skewers of meat, a small salad, a whole roasted tomato and basmati rice ($12).
the falafel were very tasty, just ever so slightly overcooked on the outside, but still extremely soft on the inside.
the hummus was also delicious with the standard chickpea and tahini flavors.  
i wasn't a huge fan of the dish the hummus was served on as i prefer it in a small bowl rather than a plate but i'm not one to judge a place on something as trivial as that.
i really enjoyed the fresh pita sprinkled with sesame seeds and could probably eat a ton of that with their hummus all day long.
my friend's dish looked delicious and i think it was since he finished the whole thing.  
i did try the basmati rice and it was very good.

zaytoon is a bit of a drive for me but i would most definitely dine here again when in the area.

When you walk in the door you're  immediately  hit with the wonderful aromas of a Persian kitchen ! The food here was the best authentic Persian food I've eaten  outside of my in laws  kitchens! I've eaten at other Persian restaurants  all over the world, but this one is the real deal!
Always enjoy coming to this restaurant the Food is the best Mediterranean  food in town .always fresh bread .Excellent
Family owned. Super friendly people. Amazingly marinated meat (had lamb and barg) and the fresh bread is a fat woman's dream! Prices are fair. Intimate setting. Will be back again for sure! Yum!

Wonderful experience here. The food was authentic and flavorful. The wait staff were quick on their feet, pleasant and professional. The rice is probably one of the best flavors. I can't wait to go back.

the customer service is great. the dude was very attentive and helpful when we asked about certain dishes. we ordered, lamb curry, chicken curry, bread, rice, hummus, and one other thing i cant remember. all the flavors were well executed and the market next to us had a lot of nice spice smells while we were waiting for our food. def would come back to eat here when i visit vegas again.

So finally got around too trying Zaytoon Mediterranean Market and Kabob. I would have to say left being a fan of the place!!! 

I really had no idea that it was this little ethnic market and restaurant. They have separate entrances if just want sit down in the restaurant. Which is the way I went so never really walked around the market. You can see that they do have lot of stuff for the size of it and couple glass displays with different stuff. My review is only for the restaurant. Next time.

The menu has nice diversity from things that could associate with like Kabob, they have speciality dishes that sound really interesting (am sure traditional Iranian food; or assume because I never had Iranian food too base personnel experience on, and sandwiches most part straight forward. On one side of the menu they do have pictures of some of the more popular dishes just in case need visual. I got to admit helped me out being first timer. I also went with trust the server and ask for their recommendation. 

I ended up going with Kashke Bademjaan (Fried Iranian Eggplant Dip) starter and Chicken Soltani as my entree. The eggplant dip was pretty awesome!! The consistency was almost like Hummus. It had nice creamy texture but still have full body of roasted eggplant. It made for perfect spread on the fresh bread. I killed whole serving of bread with the eggplant dip. The fresh bread. I loved it. It nothing like your traditional bread. I think of it like thinly rolled out dough rolled out flat then popped in oven. It thin and compare to the first batch the second batch was much more crispy with cracker style. The first batch was basically like pita bread but so much better because dough made fresh daily. The bread topped with butter or olive oil and sesame seeds. 

The Chicken Soltani. It came with two kinds of Kabob the Chicken and Koobideh. The Koobideh basically beef Kabob but it has nice flavor and liked it better then the Chicken. The chicken was good. The seasonings for the beef really stood out much more plus it was more tender and not as dried out as the chicken. The rice was interesting used two different kinds. So visual makes for nice looking rice! It was good. The salad talk about refreshing. The waiter asked if wanted have half and half. Not sure if they do it all the time. I would ask because having the best of both sides. Winnah!!! 

The service was awesome. You can tell family run business. They were super attentive and very helpful explaining the menu since it was my first time and giving me great recommendations. Friendly. 

I enjoyed my experience at Zaytoon and being close too my house sure be back again try more of the menu....
Just another choice to get groceries (ex. spices/seasonings, arabic bread, dairy, and cooking oils).
Excellent food best Persian food in town i eat here often my number 1 spot in vegas to go service is always great warm an nice people

I heard about this place through Groupon. We decided to use our Groupon last weekend. Zaytoon is a small cafe attached to a small Mediterranean market.

For an appetizer we had the Kashk-e-bademjaan which is an Iranian eggplant dip. It was good and had kind of a dark flavor. It was served with DELICIOUS fresh flat bread sprinkled with sesame seeds.

For my entree I got the Zereshk polo with barberry rice which was grilled chicken served with basmatti rice sprinkled with saffron and barberries. I had never had barberries before. They were sweet and tart and reminded me of somewhere between a currant and a lingonberry. The chicken was nicely seasoned and moist.

My wife got the Shish kabob which was skewered pieces of fillet and vegetables. It was nicely seasoned and was served with a grilled tomato and basmatti rice sprinkled with saffron.

For dessert we split the ice cream and carrot juice dish. It consisted of  cubes of saffron ice cream served in a glass of fresh carrot juice. The ice cream has rose water and pistachios mixed into it. I'm not a big fan of rose water. However, the ice cream was still pretty good. The carrot juice was delicious and refreshing. The dish was reminiscent of a root beer float. I liked it a lot and would definitely order it again.

I liked Zaytoon quite a bit and plan to go back.

Had never been here before and I've been looking to trying Persian food again. I ordered through the Yelp app. The food was really good. 

In one of the special request boxes, I asked if they could add some barberries (small currant-looking berries) to the rice, being that that was not a priced option on the menu. 

Now, I understand adding an additional charge to this request. I figured one dollar or two dollars at the most. They charged me an additional $5 for about a quarter cup of those little berries! Gimme a break! I could've ordered another appetizer at that price. I felt taken advantage of for sure. Will not be returning.

We really enjoyed eating here. We had beef and chicken kebab. We also had a vegetarian eggplant dish which was really good too. The falafel sandwich was really good too. The owner of the restaurant was very polite and gave us Persian tea which really was enjoyable.
The restaurant is in the side of a Mediterranean market, is very pleasant to eat here

We were delightfully surprised after coming upon this place quite by accident.  WOW!  The most authentic Mediterranean food we've found in Vegas!  Family owned, fantastic service, and reasonable pricing too!  Finally found out how to add my 5* rating - only took 3 attempts!
if you're looking for an authentic Iranian restaurant, this is it. Great food, and amazing service. The joojeh kabob with the Iranian rice is my favorite!

I don't know much about Persian food but I really enjoyed this place. 

I had no idea what to order but the waiter answered any questions I had about the menu. I also referred to yelp for suggested menu choices. 

I started off with the hummus since that seems like a popular item. I don't even like chickpeas but IT'S SO GOOD. It comes with fresh bread and if you're reading this please order the hummus. Do it. 

The lamb shank was tasty but I liked the chicken and beef combination plate more. The ground beef was so flavorful. To my surprise, I also enjoyed the greenish black rice that came with my lamb, according to my server it was made with dill and flava (?) beans- I've never had anything that tasted like this before and it was so delightful. 

For dessert, I had baklava and the rose water, saffron and pistachio ice cream. The ice cream was weird at first but I like its unique flavor profile. 

Dining here was such an experience and I will definitely return in the near future.
Excellent food with excellent service....they even allow my 4 lb yorkie to sit with us ......can't ask for more....thanks zaytoon.
Originally came for the small grocery store, but ordered Kababs to go on my way out. Excellent! I've found my Mediterranean restaurant.

Wonderful food and the friendliest service. I've had other kabob places, but this is by far the best. The Chicken Sandwich (Which is actually a wrap) comes with either fries or a "salad". GET THE SALAD. It's delicious.

This is ridiculous. The "chicken kabob" plate was just thrown in a bow. The second box is a "side" of rice. The box with diced up cucumbers is a "salad"? And the dessert is smaller than my hand. Last time I order from this place

According to my Persian man, the food is good.  The guy who took our order was very friendly.  It is a bit pricy I was told... 

This place is part of a grocery store:
Pros - you get to look around the store while you wait for the food and you will find exotic stuff!
Cons - i would probably not eat there.  we got our food to go, and that worked out very well.

If I could give this place 0 stars I would. This is the worst Persian food I have ever had. It's late and the whole family is hungry waited 90mins from postmates to get in edible food. 4 and 5 stars I do not believe these are real reviews with how bad the food is! 16.99 for beef that was so dry I spit it out! And it only steak rice and a grilled tomato! Over priced!! Fish had no seasoning  and fava rice had fava beans under cooked and dry dill and wayyyy to much of it. The chicken was so tiny of a positron and it says whole chicken it loook like it may have been a Cornish hen by the size sooo tiny. I am hungry and called bec I spent $72!! Thy were unhelpful when I called and offered me nothing for being dissatisfied with their food. Very upsetting. I guess McDonald's it is for the fam now
Great store and resteraunt they carry many israeli spices and things that are hard to find here. Just remember they are closed on sundays. Friendly and helpful staff also.
My favorite place to eat! The environment is so friendly and makes the experience even better. Definitely the best Persian food in Vegas.

The kebabs were delicious! I was pleasantly surprised by how big the portions were. The cucumber salad substitution is worth the money. The vegetarian kebab was simple and clean. We got a single chicken kebab for our 3 year old and she really liked it and was full. The chicken on the bone Kabab was really moist and flavorful... Especially for Cornish hen. The falafel sandwich was also really delicious. The server kept refilling our waters and did a good job. The bathrooms were a little dirty though.

I wish I could give this place more stars! My family and I have been coming here since it opened! Absolutely a hidden gem.

When you walk into Zaytoon's there is a small cafe style area in the front shared with a market full of goodies and pastries! 

My family and I love to start off with the baba ganouch! The smokiness from the roasted eggplant is a perfect spread over their warm bread they serve with it. I don't want to call it naan bread because it's much thinner and with seeds on it! So delish! 

I love love love the chicken soltani! It comes with pieces of chicken breast, koobideh, rice and roasted tomato! Need I say more?! Both the chicken and koobideh are so flavorful and marinated perfectly! All the meats there are so tender as well.

The rest of my family are barg soltani lovers... Instead of chicken on the plate, it's a marinated thin sliced beef. Both are wonderful but I love the chicken, LOL!

Be sure to save room for dessert because they have different flavored baklava! 


Ps, A++++ service!
5 Star customer service at all times.  The food is very delicious.  I like the Gemme and the chicken kabob is delish!  The hot tea of course perfect. Two Thumbs up!

This restaurant is adjacent to a market of ethnic food.
We bought there some tea and henna.
The restaurant has little exotic ambiance however the owner is kind and ready to explain all about the food. We order 5 different plates for us (the wife and the two little pirates), all of them were above average for Iranian in the US.

Oh my god , this place was a real surprise.  We had there Russian roulette where you get to choose four different appetizers,  baba gounoush , hummus , falafel and a fried Iranian eggplant dip, and the bread that come with it....wow. I was expecting a pita bread but what they brought us was the most amazing lavash I have ever tasted, like a giant cracker...but soft and flaky and right off the grill. We also shared a beef and chicken kabab with saffron basmati rice, which at this point , I was already to full to eat it, but I did, and it was absolutely fantastic. I will come here again. And I hope all of you do to! Wonderful experience. Wonderful staff, and by far some of the tastiest Mediterranean food I've had in quite some time.
Best kabob in Vegas. Love coming here. The service is great and the food is always delicious. We drive all the way from Aliante to have dinner regularly.
Love this place. We have been here several times. I love the Koobideh Kabab with white rice. Service is always friendly and prompt. The market next door has fresh breads and produce.
This has always been my favorite place to buy groceries and eat Persian food. I always order the kabob or gabzi with a ton of yogurt.

What a wonderful place to eat! We go there on a weekly basis. Sometimes we order to go and sometimes we eat at the restaurant.  The restaurant itself is very small.  Seating is definitely limited and some days they are packed. As far as food, we normally order the koobideh and that is delicious at home and at the establishment. Their ice tea is also very good. I've tried the barg and chicken kabob which I suggest eating there instead of take home since the meat tends to get a little overly cooked in the togo boxes. The family that owns this place is always inviting. They are friendly and know mostly everyone since many are repeat customers. Delicious and prices are reasonable!
Delicious kabob chicken, baba ganoush and the bread! Great service and the manager/owner Sam is so nice who also welcomed us to Vegas by giving us dessert on the house. We will be back!

I really like the atmosphere of this place more than anything. It's very small and feels family-run, which I love. All of the workers are very kind. The hummus and pita is AMAZING. I had the lamb shish kabob & it honestly was very small for the price & dry... But they have bomb hot tea & it's free refills!!!! I think I'll try another dish next time I come here!!!

Great family run restaurant .
Really loved there chicken kebabs and specially loved there fresh breads ...they are one of the best I ever had ..nice  thin ,crispy and fresh out of oven 
Highly recommended .

This restaurant is a hidden gem! We decided to try this place last night and the food was delicious! The service was great and they have a market that's connected to the restaurant. I found my favorite Sadaf tea! My family and I will be back soon!

By far the best Persian restaurant in Vegas. You have to try the ghormeh sabzi or koobideh. Also has a persian market attached if you want to cook some dishes at home. Moderately priced & family owned. They take pride in the business.

Outstanding customer service! The fresh bread is awesome. We ordered the bone in and boneless chicken. The only thing missing was the yogurt sauce that we are accustomed to eating with our food. Great choice!
I ordered three different plates.. Chicken, fish and beef. All were poor quality and tasteless.. Over done.. Bland. Waste of money

My very favorite place for Mediterranean food to go to!!
Very friendly oriented place where they make you feel welcomed! Koobideh and Sean's Sandwich(spicy) is my fav dishes!! Must try to know what heaven taste like.

First time here because of the Yelp reviews. No argument here about the stellar reviews. 

Great experience. Service was very attentive. A bit of a wait for our food because of a very large party before us. 

Food was delicious. Chicken sandwich (wrap), beef wrap and lamb kabobs with rice. All beautifully prepared and served. 

Just a really nice experience. You will like it.
Great authentic grocery store and restaurant. The service is fast, and affordable.

This is the BEST place in town for 5 Star Persian food!  They bake their own bread and combine it with beef koobideh, chicken kabob & musto mercir (yogurt dip with shallots), and it qualifies as food "porn".

Family owned, A+ service and while you're there, check out the fresh produce and selection of pastries to take home!

Been there many times, it just keeps getting better!

This place has the best Persian food in Vegas! The prices are really reasonable and the service is top notch. I've tried Paymon's before but thought it was way overpriced for mediocre food. Zaytoons has excellent hummus, and their koobideh kabob plate is to die for! There fresh baked pita bread is a must try!
Always delicious and wonderful service. Whenever we are in town we make it a must to visit Zaytoon. I highly recommend this authentic cuisine.
The staff were not friendly, service was fast, I didn't not wait long for my food. The food was ok. They should really marinate their meat before they grill it.  More flavors.

Sorry it was rough from start to finish.  Didn't feel to welcomed here.  The waiter wasn't very helpful in helping with menu items.  Overall we really felt out of place here & the food wasn't something to brag about.

GREAT FOOD!

I wish it was more of a restaurant feeling, but heck I don't mind when the food is this good :)

The Barberry rice is yummy.
One of the best Mediterranean food in vegas!! The service is awesome!! I highly recommend this place

We were in the area and had a craving for Middle Eastern cuisine.  A search on Yelp found this place.  I am not an expert on Middle Eastern food but the Chicken Kabob  I ordered was very good.  The chicken was tender and moist with a great flavor.  Love the way they cooked the rice. Fluffy and not laden with salt.  My companion ordered the Falafel Sandwich with shiraxi salad and told me it was delicious. What do you need to put together a very good restaurant? Great food and personable service, Zaytoon got both.  Zaytoon's staff are friendly and helpful in making choices.  I will come back and try out other items on the menu.

I ordered the chicken kabobs and the pistachio baklava to go today. The kabobs were good but not the best I've tasted. It tasted better with the sumac though. The rice was also good. I didn't like the raw onions they have on the side. 

The baklava was at par. There is something missing on the ingredient and I can't figure it out. It's also kind of pricey, 2 very small pieces for $2.50. 

I'll be back and will try something else.

If you love Persian food, this place is the place to be at!! I have been coming here for years now! Staff is super friendly, food is amazing, and atmosphere is great!

A few must try dishes are the hummus, baba ganoosh, lentil soup, chicken kabobs and kafta!!!

I didn't know this myself, but I might be on mission to try the the different foods of the Mediterranean. I realize after tasting the food here that the names may sound similar, but there is a flavor difference. In all Mediterranean restaurants I've treated my flavor palette to, I have not been let down - including Zaytoon.

Chicken kabob plate: served with a good portion of rice. Side of sliced onions; a fave with any meat and balances flavors. Chicken so soft it probably doesn't require chewing - but please do. Recommend the chicken kabob a thousand percent for poultry eaters.

Beef kabob sandwich: added avocado - delicious choice! It's wrapped like a burrito; makes it easy to eat. Ordered with cucumber salad. Healthy meal - loved it! 

Almost got the chicken sandwich . I'm sure I'd be in love with that considering the flavor and texture of the chicken in the plate mentioned above. 

First try of Torshi. Pickled veggies unlike the raw crunchy pickled veggies I'm used to. This appeared almost sauteed cooked. It would've been perfect with a beef rice plate. I made do and ate it with the flat bread with butter, or put some in my sandwich before each bite.

Restaurant shares space with a small grocery store. Wish I had more time to browse and ask questions. 

Anywhoobees, pleasant service from the gentleman and lady tending to a busy lunch time. Also to the chefs in the kitchen for getting our food out in good time although it started getting really busy. We didn't wait long at all to be seated, or for our orders.

There is a broad availability of Mediterranean food choices here in Vegas. I'm gonna enjoy the search and find. Just like Pokemon Go fans at the parks, I'm on it for the ethnic food hunt.

My husband and I come here probably once a month or so. I love Mediterranean food and this place is very close to where we live. I've been to quite a few Mediterranean restaurants in town but this one ia definitely near the top of the list as a favorite. Everything I've had is so good, fresh, perfectly seasoned. My favorites are the shirazi salad, the dolmas, and pretty much any of the lamb dishes are fantastic. The iced tea is even amazingly different than any I've had in my life! Of course we end the meal with Baklava and today we had the pistachio ice cream with saffron and rose water, what a treat!

Only complaint is that they tend to get very busy and the restaurant only has 6 tables, so it fills up quickly. There is an attached market that we have yet to shop at, but is also pretty busy. 

Definitely recommend this place for lunch! Just arrive before noon :)
Their grills are out of this world! Only the way a Persian can cook it. I'm coming back for more for sure!

Hands down one of the best kabob establisments in Las Vegas. The quality is always consistent and fresh. As for the service, the owners are always friendly and do their best to help you select what will fit your need. The prices are also reasonable for the amount of you get.
Very good Persian food. Portions were a bit on the small side, but the flavor made up for it.

Wow.really?one of the best of the best service,people and food in the us.highly recommended.

Wow to their white fish.loved it

Been coming here for years but just now writing a review.  Coming from LA where there are a plethora of Mediterranean restaurants,  this place would give them a run for their money. 

First,  the service is great! They are constantly busy but yet still make you feel welcomed.  Waiters and hostess are attentive and very warm.  On my last occasion dining in, a family came in with a child that had disabilities. The staff seemed to know them and made sure to welcome them. They made special orders to accommodate their needs and you could see that they genuinely cared about the family. As a person who has volunteered to work with children with disabilities, this was wonderful to see. Thank you staff for your good hearts. 

Now for the food...eat here...seriously. The lovely combination of flavors in their koobideh is perfect. Love the rice and it's always cooked just perfect.  Nooo hard bits..but uniformed tenderness. You don't need to add the sumac powder, but why skip it? The pita comes out hot, fresh and airy..huge by the way.  You could swaddle a puppy in that thing... The eggplant dip is awesome,  must try.  Just the right texture to go with the pita. I've tried all the different meats and other special rice.  Do yourself a favor and explore this menu.. it will be a flavorful journey.

Came into this place because it had good reviews on Yelp. The review's did NOT let me down. This place is awesome from the service, to the price, to the food. Everything is so delicious here. I've gone twice in the last week, BEWARE you will have serious withdrawals and cravings from this place.

Food is delicious and amazing customer service. The kabobs are amazing. I usually dine in but recently ordered for pick up. Portion wasn't any different than what I would receive dining in which made me happy. You know some places rip you off that way.

Really good food.  My gyro wrap came with about 6 falafels in total in the wrap, full with tomatoes, onion, and fantastic tzatziki sauce.  The dish additionally came with a sirazi salad.  The falafel was dry but didn't necessarily fall apart.  The wrap stuck together well and it wasn't drenched in sauce as some wraps tend to be.  I was hoping for pita instead of a wrap, but that might be one of those ask and you shall receive type of things.  The salad was unexpectedly good.  Usually the wraps I have come a la carte, so when I was told a salad is complimentary, my hopes were not high.  Wet cucumber and tomato, with a nice acidic flavor.  The combo was a perfect lunch.

The downside to the meal was two-fold.  First, I asked for the sauce in my wrap on the side and it came on.  Not the biggest deal, but I expect the customer to always be right.  Second, they charge you $1 fee for using a credit card to pay.  This was not told to me when I paid so when my bill came back $1 more, without warning, I was a little pissed off. Besides these two happenings, I really enjoyed my lunch at Zaytoon.
Ive been coming here since the opened and the food has always been great! Everyone is very friendly and the place is clean, I enjoy the maket next door. Great food great prices.

Very authentic place and food. I love that it is close to my area and easy to find. It is also family owned, and you can see how they take care of their customers.
