This restaurant is attached to a small grocery where you can find a lot of Mediterranean food and specialties. I would definitely keep this in your radar if you're looking for something authentic and good.

We decided today when were eating this phenomenal middle eastern food that we are so sad for people who are unadventurous eaters.  In general Middle Eastern food is flavorful and healthy and delicious.  Zaytoon was all of that and more.  We ate dinner there, where there is only about 7 tables.  The waiter and waitress were extremely friendly and sweet.  We started with their baba ghanoush that was so good I got an extra order to go home.  It came with a great fresh baked flatbread.  For entrees we got their "bone in chicken kabob" which was actually a whole cornish game hen cut into pieces, marinated and grill.  Super moist and flavorful.  It came with rice, an onion salad and a blistered tomato.  We also got their special which was a lamb shank and might have been one of the best lamb shanks we have ever had.  Delicious.  We walked out very happy.

Also they have fresh juices that they juice to order.  I got the watermelon and the boy got carrot and beet together.  Both were delicious and refreshing.  I will definitely go back, but just something to keep in mind, this isn't a huge restaurant, it is a very intimate setting.  But I love it and will be back for some juice soon!

Great food , friendly staff. They have a  great selections of delicious Persian foods. They also have a grocery store connected to their restaurant.  The food is so good . I will never go anywhere else. Best customer service ever.  I will keep coming back.

Me and my husband first time here. And we love it !!Excellent kabobs , so juicy , and so much flavor.  Friendly people. Clean place, really good food ! Must try! Can't wait to come back again !!:)  and the ground beef kabob is to die for !! :)

If you like Persian food this is the place to go. Every time we goto vegas I have to visit. The kabob is cooked to perfection, the bread is to die for, and the owners (who work there every day apparently) are the nicest people I have ever met. I recommend the KGB if you don't like a lot of rice. Seriously I might have to plan a trip just to visit this place. Typing this review is making me so hungry!!

I was early to my manicure appointment so my husband and I took this opportunity to explore. Had we not just came from having lunch, we would have sat at the restaurant and tried a few things. Instead we spent a good 20-minutes exploring the many items in the market. 

The market is small so the aisles are narrow. Floors are filled with product, just the way I like it. Many of the items on the shelf are in script, but if you turn it over. You'll find the information in English. 

There's a small deli area filled with fresh sausage, halva, fresh Bulgarian cheese, a variety of fresh baklava and olives. 

Employees are very helpful. 

My husband and I left with a few things, but we'll be back for a meal and a box of hello kitty chocolate eggs with the the toys in em. Yah, they have that too.

Great little Persian Market and restaurant in LV. Was not expecting much from the appearance however I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the food the great price point and the friendly customer service.
This is the best Mediterranean food in Las Vegas and it's not even close!  The bread is hot and fresh and the rest is just as good!  Forget the rest and come to the best!

I was recommended this Persian restaurant by a co-intern, so I decided to come check it out. I ordered the barg soltani, which comes with one skewer of barg and one of koobideh. I like that I was offered the option of getting a smaller portion of rice and getting some salad with my entree as well, to make for a more balanced meal. I also ordered the kashke bademjaan (fried eggplant dip). You are also given a complimentary piece of flatbread, which comes out hot, and is fairly large in size.

The entree came with the standard saffron rice and roasted tomato. I'm used to receiving roasted roma tomatoes, but I think they used a different tomato variety at Zaytoon. 

Overall, the food was very tasty, though a bit pricey. The barg was also a bit of a thinner cut than I am used to. Service was very friendly and attentive though. 

After my meal, I also browsed the adjacent market next door and picked up a few items.

P.S. They charge a $1 fee for all credit card use, regardless of the amount. A little bit annoying given that the fee assessed by the credit card company to the merchant is definitely not $1 per transaction; I would rather that they have a minimum charge for credit card use.
Great food! The rice, the kabobs, salad, it was all fresh tasteful perfectly cooked. Fair prices. Very friendly people. They have gained my business for sure
I finally found Persian food in vegas :) the food is great and the market is pretty cool too. The owners are absolute sweethearts! Definitely a great spot to satisfy my cravings :)

Very unprofessional staff. Ordered soltani. The barg tasted as if it was on the verg of spoilage. The kobideh was good. The bread awsom. The portion small on a petit platter to make it look full. Not same as photo on web page. One very small butter patty for rice. The rice ok. But $20 + sales tax: very much over priced. The place very small and no vibes or feeling. No persian music. Sorry will not come back.

This place is amazing. The prices are great, the amount of food is very filling (you can share some dishes), the staff is extremely friendly, and the food is out of this world. The best I've ever had. We'll be coming back here at least once a week. 

I like the grocery store too. It's cute and has some very unique food.

I am kind of unsure how to review Zaytoon so I'll let it work itself out as I write!

When we first walked in, it was kind of awkward because the hostess/waitress just... didn't say anything at all? She was friendlier later on, though.

We started our meal with bread and yogurt-shallot dip which, I'm not sure what I was expecting but it basically just tasted like your standard sour cream and onion dip. The bread it was served with, however, was totally fantastic! Hot, fresh, crisp, a little chewy, flavored with sesame seeds- the bread was top notch!

For our main dishes we shared the chicken soltani plate (chicken kabob and koobideh) and the barg kabob. The barg was juicy and flavorful but I was expecting more big chunks of steak instead of a thin slice. The chicken was really tasty and the koobideh was flavorful. It was all served with rice, grilled tomato and onion. I wished I had saved some of the bread/dip to make a sandwich out of it all- it was delicious!

We had to get some Persian ice cream for dessert because I've been obsessed ever since I tried it at Saffron and Rose in LA and Lavash in San Francisco. The ice cream is from Mashti Malone in LA and it is amazing, but you don't have to eat it there for dessert... you can buy it by the pint in the market next door! That's what I did after the meal and I'm totally going back for more. It is some of the best ice cream EVER- so much flavor.

Overall, our meal was really good and everything was high quality. I am really torn between 3 and 4 stars but I think if I had made slightly smarter menu choices, it would definitely be 4- I think this is a 4 star establishment and I will go back again for lunch for sure.

Part market, part restaurant. But, it's all good. From the outside of this family owned shop you'll be unaware of the awesomeness that lies within. After several visits it's become my regular spot for Mediterranean food. 

Their two page menu is packed with tantalizing dishes. But after visiting here at least once a week for the past month I'm addicted to the koobideh kabob ($9.99) -- two skewers of ground beef marinated in a wonderful blend of spices. I've tried other items but keep going back to my first love -- the koobideh. The chicken kabobs ($9.99) are well seasoned and usually enough food for two meals. If you want to try both, get the chicken soltani ($12.99)  which has one skewer each of the chicken and koobideh. The filet in the Barg kabob ($16.99) was decent, but a little tough. For apps, the falafels ($3.99) and hummus ($3.99) are as good as you'll find anywhere in town.
The kebobs with fresh bread (lavash) was great, but i suggest them to use difference rice.

My husband and I had the pleasure of dining here this evening. Everything from the lavash, to the baba ganoush, to the koobideh, to the fesenjaan was absolutely wonderful. The waiter was so friendly and nice. It was a great experience overall!

The food in this little behind the scenes cafe is off the charts. The kebabs are the best in Vegas, and the rice dishes are home-made. This is not where you go for atmosphere or romantic settings, this is where you go to eat! Try the fesanjoon, it's ridiculous

YELP 365 CHALLENGE 2014-(219/365) "Extending An Olive Branch of Deliciousness"

Although Zaytoon(translates to "Olive")  has been around for years, we finally got to experience this restaurant/market, and having been here twice already, I am truly a fan of this local family owned business!

 The appetizers are a great start for a meal, and if you have a big party, the Hummus, Baba Ganoush, and Masto Khiar(love.this.stuff!!!) are all delicious and great for sharing. Baskets of Taftoon(flatbread with Sesame and Nigella Seeds)are brought to your table along with the apps, and if you run out, simply ask for more!

We've tried the delicious fall-off-the-bone Lamb Shank here too, but my favorite plate as of now is the Barg Soltani, a combination of their Iranian-style Filet and Koobideh with Basmati and Saffron Rice, onions, butter, and a grilled tomato. Their fresh squeezed juices are a great addition to your meal as well, and after your meal, you can shop around in their market next door.

Service here is also pleasant and the owner and his wife are always so personable.
Zaytoon is definitely going into our lunch/dinner rotation. Oh, they also have Mashti Malones killer ice creams from LA for sale up front in the market side if you're not too stuffed from lunch or dinner!  ALOHA!!!

Shaka Meter:  \uuu/   \uuu/   \uuu/   \uuu/  4

Here happened one of the best meals I've had in a very long time, in terms of Middle Eastern food. I had the chicken kabob entree with a side of bread and garlic sauce. I've enjoyed every single bite, slowly and with complete satisfaction for over an hour. 

The service was incredible and the staff was above and beyond kind. I came on Christmas eve and every table was packed so I opted for a To Go meal. The owner encouraged me to sit and eat my meal and cleaned up a table for me as soon as someone got up (within 5 min) even though they were very busy. 

I could not have been more pleased with my food, the service and the $8.99 bottle of avocado oil I purchased at the attached store. Cannot wait to be back ASAP.
great place for kebobs. very small persian/iranian cafe with good food. kebobs and mast o mooshir baby
Very happy! Such a fine find! Love Persian food and they know how to serve it!

Saw the reviews and had to stop by out of curiosity since a lot of Mediterranean restaurants have great reviews but the food usually came mediocre. But this place definitely lived up to its review and more. I ended up ordering the Koobideh which is full of flavor and was actually very moist. The falafel which my husband usually hates even loved since it wasn't bland and served with a flavorful dip which I don't think was hummus but way better. And I had to try their bread since it was only a dollar and it was very fresh and still hot when I got home. It was soft in the center and crisp around the edges. Definitely coming back (soon and often). The restaurant and store was small and cute but importantly very clean and everyone there was so nice and willing to help.

We feel welcomed everytime we eat here. The staff is very accomodating and we can see even other customers are very happy. The food is fairly priced. Chicken kabob is tender and juicy. My wife loves their koobideh too. This is our go to Med place to eat.
A great family ran place. I crave their kubideh and have to have them every time I'm in town. The fresh bread is awesome and several selections of baklava

I went in one day because my pregnant sister had a craving for some candy that she couldn't find anywhere until someone told her she could find it at Zaytoon's. So I went to pick one up for her.  While I was there, I noticed all their middle eastern goods. They had some tasty looking desserts & those can of persian pickles I love. There was a deli section that consist of big fat olives,  two kinds feta cheese & mortadella. The young man at the register was very friendly & gave me a to go menu to check out their restaurant. 

 I came back again w/ my boyfriend who is Persian & my kids who are half for Persian New Years & bought many of their pastries, ice cream & faloudeh. The FARD in the blue cylinder is AMAZING!!! $15, but so worth it. It was so addicting. Like a drug. 

We ordered food to go in their restaurant area. When we got home, I was impressed. It was good. Usually my boyfriend is pretty picky w/ eating Persian Food at restaurants cause he's use to his mama's homemade Persian meals. We ordered the soltani kebabs which came w/ rice, onions w/ chopped parsley & a large grilled onion.  I thought it was way better than some other Persian restaurants I went to here in Vegas. We ended up coming back & ordering the chicken & kebab koobideh. It came out fresh & delicious! Ah so good! I know I'm going to be regular here for sure! I'm so glad my sister had a craving for white toberlone or I would have not known about this place.

Food was great! Service was awesome! We got koobideh, chicken and bone-in chicken (cornish hen) plus the shirazi salad. It all came with rice, broiled tomatoes, sumac & onion w/ parsley (we didn't eat saut√©ed w/ egg for breakfast ). I didn't know what Napoleons were but now I do. My husband loved it. One of the desserts they had, a pastry one. I got this because I thought that Baklava would be too sweet for us. We devoured it!!!!  We will definitely go back. They also have that mini supermarket on the side.

Best place to get Persian in the city! Reasonable, fast, and the staff is extremely friendly. Not only are you able to sit down and enjoy lunch or dinner, but they also have the market attached so you can pick up some speciality items that cannot be found in most grocery stores.

Koobideh kabob is my favorite, ground beef skewered with traditional spices. Comes with rice, grilled tomato and chopped raw onions. Great place for lunch.

I came here for lunch and I must say I was impressed. The prices are super reasonable the service was amazing and the food was great. There was a younger gentlemen that was our server I believe he was the owner. He was very kind. 

We ordered the hummus and vegetarian dolmas (stuffed grape leaves) for our appetizers. I enjoyed the dolmas so much that I could have ordered to of those and been happy. We shared an entree which was the chicken and beef kabob with rice. The chicken kabob was delicious and the beef was just okay. The rice was decent although I have had better. It was a bit plain and needed some flavor. 

It was a great meal for $22 and will be back! Oh and the restaurant is in a cute Mediterranean market.

Went there do dinner one night. Place is kind of weird having a market and a restaurant together. I ordered the Koobdeh kabob which was really good tender and juicy also ordered the Shiraz salad which was great. The salad was chopped in fine pieces which I really appreciated. (Hate when restaurants just throw globs of big pieces of vegetables and call it a salad.) also ordered the kashk-e-bademjaan which was really good.

My wife ordered the shish kabob which was really juicy and tender the rice was a bit oily for our taste. It also came with a grilled tomato which was good.

After dinner went to the market and started shopping they got a lot of middle eastern products that are hard to find in the valley.

This place is a keeper!

I love family owned/operated places, and this one definitely is, the owner was running the store and serving food/taking orders and still managed to be polite, kind.  Onto the food, it was a hard decision, the sturgeon sounds wonderful but I am not a fan of farm raised fish, so I decided to pass and I tried the Barg Kabob which is Iranian cut filet, perfectly seasoned, tender and delicious. The basmati rice had good flavor, touch of saffron. I also tried the Masto Khiar which is yogurt cucumber side served with Barbari, Persian flat bread. Simply amazing, I could have eaten it with a spoon, and honestly I did take a couple bites without bread (i couldn't help myself). I had to try the pistachio with saffron and rose water first, it was good, but I have to say other one that had the fresh carrot juice had a more interesting flavor, I could really taste the rose water in it. I love that they carry Mashti Malone's ice cream. 


Also took home some pistachio & sesame halva, and sumac, oh and sweet lemons. 

Great food and service.

WOW. Thoroughly satisfied and my belly is full, full, full. Went with my parents and my aunt and uncle. They pulled two tables together for us and sat right down. Got our drinks and started gazing at the menu. My uncle was curious about a sauce they had listed for one of their menu items, a pomegranate & walnut sauce. They were nice enough to bring a sample of the sauce out for us to try. Was good. Never would have guessed that those two things were the main ingredients. We ordered some Hummus, Babaganoush, and their salad for appetizers. The bread they brought out was AMAZING! Everything else was good also, except the salad was seasoned a little strong. Then the main dish came out. I ordered the koobideh dish that came with rice. YUM. I finished off the dish even though I was full half way thru. Everyone else enjoyed the food as well. I was very happy with this place and definitely will be going back. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Could not have been happier. I didn't have time to browse through their market, but like I said, I will be back.

Small restaurant inside the Mediterranean market.   The home made bread was great.  Large portioned entrees were delicious.  Offered a variety of fresh juices.  The waiter/store manager was extra friendly.

Trying new places out with Groupons or LivingSocial's brought me to Zaytoon.  Sometimes it's really uncomfortable going to mom and pop places to eat because the owners take TOO much interest in how you're liking your meal.  This place was pretty perfect.  The service was great, and I could tell I was ordering and being served from the owner.  The food was pretty good, too.  Why only 3 stars?  Well, nothing really jumped out at me as being amazing.  It was good, but just nothing amazing.  Not sure I'd come back unless I picked up another deal for the place.
Best food! Very fresh and delicious every time I order and dine in. Not for large groups but perfect for a quick lunch or dinner.

Zaytoon has been my favorite eating experience during my Vegas stay. I love Persian food and can not too often find places that sell it. The eggplant dip is on point, so is the yogurt and scallion dip (mast o masir). I'm pretty sure all the food is awesome  but I can't try it all in one visit unfortionately. Every one was friendly and our food came out quickly. I also like that Zaytoon opens at 9am. The restaurant is attached to a market that sells all of your persian staples. Its a cool place to shop for new ingredients to cook with.
Best Persian restaurant in Vegas. The food and service are amazing! Would come back if I lived in town.

I eat this kind of food often and this place was very good.   I had a the soltani plate so ground beef and kabob.   The meat was seasoned well.   Rice and bread was good too.   Ice tea was excellent which is important to me since it's my go to drink.   The service was very good and they were very friendly too.   I will be coming back.

After seeing the reviews from some good Yelp friends, I knew I had to stop and try Zaytoon.  My friends are right.  This place is great!

I've only had Persian food once, in Los Angeles, so I'm still learning.  After studying the menu, I went with their KGB sandwich--Koobideh Kabob that's served on their fresh baked bread and served with some sliced onion, plenty of basil greens, a roasted tomato, and a grilled jalape√±o.  The beef was excellent.  The juices soaked the bread that covered the entire plate.  I got an iced tea with my dinner.

Service was excellent.  An older man waited on me originally and then was replaced by a younger man--the owner, I believe.  Iced tea was refilled twice with no need to ask for a refill.  The server checked back to make sure everything was OK.

Since I'm such a babe in the woods with this cuisine, I asked the owner if there was a correct way to eat the food.  He said what I had done was exactly the way he does it.  Let the juices soak the bread and enjoy all the richness of the dish.

I left without checking out the store section.  When I got home I saw Tony's photo of the ice cream and I wanted to kick myself.  However, with how good this meal was, I'll be a regular.  I have to try some different dishes and enjoy some dessert.

I had no idea that the restaurant portion of this place would be a little rag-tag operation in the back of a market. But don't let looks deceive you - it really is not bad!

It didn't quite live up to my hopes based on all of the reviews, but what my wife and I had was good, if not rather expensive for what it was. I was truly disappointed in my barg, which despite being filet mignon was served in a razor-thin sheet of meat instead of delectable, three-dimensional bites. I honestly preferred the kibbedeh (ground beef) to the filet. The chicken soltani was decent but could've used more spice.

The shallot and yogurt dip was indistinguishable from standard sour cream, but the bread that came with it was pretty good - fluffy and a little buttery, with a good texture.

If you don't have a fountain and serve your pop in bottles, then Mexican Coke is a must, and they don't disappoint there either.

Service was a bit erratic, and some strange man - who I don't think worked at the restaurant or the market - came up to our table and offered us cookies. Stupidly, I accepted but luckily didn't die.

tl;dr I would go back but get something different.
THey have the best koobideh in town.  I like it with their homemade bread much more than the rice.  But try it both ways.
Not very many Persian restaurants in town, so I'm sooo happy They exist and their food is great. Customer service is great as well.

Whoa! Most Mediterranean spots I go to I usually love because their food is always packed with flavor. BUT, Zaytoon for me; tops it all! I love Koobideh, and their ground beef Koobideh is amaze balls! I loved every bite. I asked for a garlic cream sauce to go with it and the waiter brought back a garlic sandwich sauce which complimented it so well! He also offered a chili oil paste and said it would greatly accompany the beef; he was NOT kidding. It was so good! I never had spicy koobideh before and this was a new exciting taste for me! 

Their baba ganoush appetizer was also great and I love their bread here. It's not too thick! 

This place is definitely my new go to Mediterranean spot when I'm in Vegas! Yum!

Great place great food mostly great people running this place! Being out of country and contacting them for an order to be made and deliver to a place and they did everything to  help me ! Delicious food and amazing quality !
Authentic, clean and very reasonably priced. The restaurant is also part of a mini Mart with authentic middle eastern goods. One stop shopping made simple if you wanted to grab ready made food to go!

Would give -1 star if I could. Went there with my gf and there were only a few tables there (which were full) except one 2-person table which we headed toward but two other people jumped right in front of us and took the table. No one sat them there. The waiter told us to wait and another table would open up soon. After waiting about 15 minutes a table opened  up so we promptly sat down before  anyone else walked in and took it. A little while later we saw another group come in looking for a table. Meanwhile the staff cleared our table and got us drinks and we were looking at the menu and after about 10 minutes another waiter came over and said there's a waiting list of people in front of us and we have to give up the table. Wait what? We've been there for about a half hour now and were the only ones waiting and no one said anything about a waiting list. I complained and said that's ridiculous there was no wait list. He didn't care. I guess it was his friends who wanted a table so we said a few choice words and left. Not gonna eat at a place that treats people like that.

So I grew up in Cleveland, OH, in a Lebanese-American family (Mom's side) that had been going to Alladin's Bakery on E.9th and Carnegie for decades. I had been hoping to find something similar in Las Vegas, a great restaurant and bakery, and I think I have found it! I had no idea it was a bakery when I ordered from Zaytoons, but i was pleasantly surprised to see a shelf after shelf of middle eastern goods for purchase! So I made my way up to the counter on the restaurant side and spoke to a man (may have been the owner) and asked if I could buy some Dolma (appetizers wrapped in grape leaves) and he gave me 4 for free. Now THAT is something that impresses me. After eating their AMAZING baba ganooj, dolma, and KGB sandwich, after being greeted warmly by each member of their staff, they earned each of these 5 stars. I own a local business myself in town and we pride ourselves on treating our customers as clients we want to impress and retain. I'm impressed by Zaytoon's attention to food quality and customer service. I will definitely be coming back!
Really good Iranian food. Good and fast service. Family business and they care about quality
Just great! Eating, shopping, talking about food, asking "ooh, what's that?", it's all great! Not a central location, but well worth the journey

Excellent service and food! We got the chicken kabob. It was juicy and very tasty. 
The owners are awesome and seem to really love what they do. They also have a little shop next door if you need some middle eastern spices, etc. Love this place !

* Delicious, hot, fresh dishes
* Welcoming, friendly service 
* Generous portions, good value
* Casual, non-pretentious environment 
* Iranian-run (authentic Persian food, warm Persian hospitality) 
* Unique market is fun to browse

As a new resident of Las Vegas I plan to return often!

I love this little eatery.  I always try to minimize how much beef and pork I eat, and chicken can get boring but I always look forward to coming here and getting chicken I am more than satisfied with.  They're so nice here and it's a very cute place with just 7 tables.  I order to go at the counter and they offer me tea while I wait.  It is connected to their grocery store and deli.  I just love places in Vegas that feel cozy and and friendly.  The beef kabobs are good even though I don't order them.  I get the bone in Cornish hen kabobs now.. So yummy!!!! I'm patiently waiting for my to go order and enjoying my tea.
Very convenient to shop for Mediterranean goodies and also have a quick bite there.

I was excited for this place, I really wanted to like it. But the food was gross. I still feel nauseous even as I write this review, several hours after I attempted to eat here.

The chicken kabob was tough and flavorless, the koobideh was unsavory, gristly, and left an odd taste lingering in my mouth. 

The service wasn't too great either. No one welcomed me, or even spoke a word to me, except when they told me how much to pay and to say goodbye as I left. My order was even taken with facial gestures and nods. Just odd.

Stumbled across this Persian Restaurant when I realized the restaurant I wanted to go to was only open for dinner!  The restaurant is connected to a grocery store and is small but family run and they are so friendly.

They had a lunch special - Fava rice with a lamb shank for 13.99 The shank was large and tender and the sauce was yummy over the fava rice. They also have great ice tea here also which was thirst quenching on a hot day. The woman even gave me a refill to go.

I wouldn't thing twice about returning here again although it's a way from the strip.

The food here is consistent and delicious. I usually order the chicken soltani. Some of my other favorite dishes are the chicken kabob with barberries, the lamb kabob, and filet. They also have the best homemade bread that is excellent with the baba ganoush!

Excellent customer service!

This place could be a five, but I've only visited once. Places like this just make me happy--locally owned, regionally specific, unpretentious, friendly, unique. It's half market, half eatery and ALL superb. The food was freshly prepared and delicious. I only had the chicken sandwich wrap while digitally waiting in line at the nearby DMV, but it's obvious from the rest of the menu and the plates coming out around me, and the offerings in the market, that this place is for real. I'll be back to try some of the more exotic dishes, and can't wait.
The food here is amazing!! I got the Barg Kabob and it was excellent. I drive the extra few miles because this place is definitely worth it.

Oh my!  I love this little hidden gem.  This restaurant is attached to a Mediterranean market in front of Desert Breeze Park.  Their koobideh is to die for!  It's always super juicy and tasty.  It comes with basmati rice, a grilled tomato, and onions. I always take it to go since the restaurant is on the smaller side.  The whole ride home is almost torture because the food smells so good!  Everyone there is also nice as well.  Definitely try this place out if you're craving Mediterranean food.

You don't see to many Persian restaurants that make their own bread. You get a fresh bread with any of your order. I haven't seen prices this low. I hate to say it, but they should raise their price for an outstanding service and quality.

Been coming here since I was little- my family has loved this spot for years. The food is the best persian food in vegas and tastes the most authentic. My family grew up in Shiraz and know the richness and flavor good persian food has. This place is cozy and ran by two wonderful people. I always take friends here who want to taste persian food because I want their first impression to be a good one!
I ordered the shish kabob and it was amazing. Plus they offer free home bread which was home made.

I was so thrilled that I finally came in here to dine! I've driven past it many times and never thought to stop in until I read the great reviews on Yelp.

It's a small grocery shop joined by the small dining area on the other side. The grocery side has some exotic offerings that you would have a tough time finding anywhere else. I've become addicted to the Mashti Malones pistachio. It's not your average pistachio.. it's bright yellow and you can taste cardamom, rose water, whole chewy pistachio bits! It's insane! I haven't purchase anything here but the ice cream, to be honest.. once I found it it was like tunnel vision.. However, the produce seems to be very reasonable and I could see myself coming here for vegetables now.

So, the restaurant portion! They offer freshly made juices with some interesting combinations like carrot and rose water. I had a watermelon juice which was delightful and oh-so refreshing. On my first visit here, the service was sort of spotty. On the second visit, they were much much friendlier, and maybe this comes from them treating you more like a regular once they know you're not just a one time visit.

The fresh warm lavash they serve here is dotted with sesame seeds and blistered just a little bit. They'll bring you an unending amount of this bread until you say Uncle!  It seems to be made to order, and is perfect for dipping in their bracing hummus, enlivened from the addition of lemon juice. I find most hummus seems to lean towards lemon, or tahini. Theirs is lemony. Oh, and endless lavash. The server was kind of enough to make many recommendations and answer any question without missing a beat. Did I mention endless lavash?

So far here I've had their chicken kabob wrap with house salad. The chicken was cooked perfectly, and seasoned well. The fresh tomatoes in there just added to brightness of the wrap, and it was big enough that I took half of it home. The salad is a mix of tomatoes, cucumbers and onions that have been diced and tossed with some parsley, mint, lemon and olive oil.

The koobideh is seasoned ground beef kabob, which is very traditional, and amazing! Very tender, perfectly seasoned, a lot of interesting flavors. All of the kabobs come with steamed rice and a charred tomato. Love me some charred tomato!

Long over-due review : )

I came here about 7 months ago with my ex and son. Hes Persian and wanted to go somewhere besides Sababa. I found this gem on Yelp and off we went. Its pretty easy to find and its a smaller eatery. One side is the resturant and the other is the market. Youre greeted by the owners as you walk in and they seat you. I love family owned businesses!! My ex asked if they spoke Farsi and of course they did so off into a convo they went. The waitress was very kind and caring towards my son and I. 

I ordered the chicken sandwich and my ex got the koobideh combo. We were given the pita, which i wasnt a fan of and sat there talking and waiting for our food. My ex devoured like 3 pitas and I peeked at the market area. The waitress was super sweet and even gave my son lots of attention.

Our food arrived and it was hot and looked yummy! The fries with my wrap thing were seasoned super good and the wrap was also succulent and delish! My bf said his food was also juicy and yummy! Pretty standard persian food here, just a little pricey. Mostly bc I think they use Halal. 

We def will come back! My son is in love with the waitress! Lol.
I've tried a lot of Mediterranean places and by far this one is the best!! Also, the best service of all time!

Love, love, love this restaurant.  The food is fantastic and the owners are sweet.  The service is always great.  

Their bread and cucumber sour cream with dill appetizer is fantadtic!!!! Their chicken kabobs, beef and koobideh is mouth watering.  The rice is hot and fluffy.  Just pure delicious yumminess.  My children love the food here.  I order at least once a week.

I haven't even tasted the food and I am saying 5 stars. Why? 1. The fact it's packed - not an empty seat. 2. The smell- OMG!! I'm so excited to eat. 3. I asked a menu question and the service! He said let me grab you a sample. 4. Then as I am waiting they say let me get you a cup of tea & baklava while you wait. Yeah I love customer service!! And the tea & baklava are SO good!!
We love this place.  It's a small gem hidden inside of a grocery store.  The owner and his wife are very friendly and always go the extra smile to make us feel welcome.  I ALWAYS get the KGB.

Went to this place for a quick lunch due to the yelp ratings and definitely was not disappointed. This place is amazing great little whole in wall. Nice atmosphere with some amazing food. Food was better and different than expected. The service was great so friendly and nice drinks were kept full and quick with everything. I will definitely be back and would recommend this place.
my wife is half Persian and really enjoyed it here. one of the top places we have eaten here in the states. music and everything!

I had the barg kabob and the masto khiar. Both were delicious. I even mixed some of the masto khiar with the rice to cool the jalape√±o and it tasted great! The guy who ran the restaurant side was extremely well mannered and always made sure we were good. Also, every time he had an order up I noticed he always said "please" when speaking to the cooks! Finally, a place where respect and manners are actually practiced!!!

5 out of 5 stars!

I ordered Zaytoon for a Bachelorette Party weekend in Vegas with 9 girls.  I worked and confirmed the order with Saam through email (easiest way for me to organize it since I am in Orange County, CA).  Saam helped me figure out how many of each item we would need and I never felt like he was over estimating, he thought I was over estimating which shows how honest he is! 

We ordered Lubia Polo, Koobideh kabobs, boneless chicken Kabobs, gormeh sabzi, gheimeh, shirazi salad, mastro khiar, hummus, and rice all buffet style.  Saam and I arranged a time to meet in the lobby of the cosmopolitan (where we were staying) and he was prompt and on time with the food along with garnishes, plates, utensils, and napkins (nice and thoughtful touch)!

The bride and a few of the girls are Persian and some of the girls had never had Persian food.  We all LOVED the food! We ate it for dinner on Saturday night, after then club for a snack, for breakfast the next day, and for dinner that night again (we stayed in a suite at Cosmo with a full kitchen which allowed us to do this).  Saam was right, I did order too much food but it was amazing and we ate every last bit of it! I have had Persian food before and Zaytoon is authentic and delicious.

Next time I am in Vegas I know where to go for Persian food!  I highly recommend this place, amazing service and food!

we went there with family (2 Persian Hosts) have attitudes .that was our first time.when  we try to seat the rude lady said don't sit .that reserved .with attitude .we said ok sorry we did not know that. we wait  nobody came its small grocery store not restaurant .food was not  fresh. they used  LEFTOVER  meat from their grocery.price was ok. rice cooked very well but kabob was dry and bad smell. Don't think I'll be back.
I eat here so much,they named A sandwich after me. .check out the seandwich. This is the Sean salad.

Freaking amazing food at this hidden gem.  I must of passed by this place a thousand times without noticing until a friend told me about this place.  I will definitely be back.  FYI, their closed on Sundays.

I was on a business trip in Las Vegas and a good friend took me to Zaytoon to enjoy a Persian meal. I enjoyed the hot bread at Zaytoon served for appetizer and the casual ambiance of the restaurant with beautiful decorations. I recommend this place to all people who love good food at a reasonable price plus great Middle Eastern food that Zaytoon market offers.

Service attentive and friendly. Persian tea very good with refills freely given.  All entries very good but bone-in Cornish game hen kabobs were outstanding. Freshly baked lavash great as well as baba ghanoush and shirazi cucumber salad.  Not to be missed is also khiar shoor to use sort of like a chutney to mix with the rice and broiled tomato served with all entrees.  An entree is filling and felt there was good value.

I would come here for the hummus and bread alone. Soft and warm, that bread was like nothing else I've ever had. 

Luckily their menu has many other fantastic items to choose from too.  We enjoyed everything we tried - it almost felt as if we were enjoying home cooking.  This ended up being the highlight of our food tour of Vegas this time around - and we ended up here completely by chance!

We spotted this place while trying to find a place to get dessert. I was pretty excited because I enjoy trying new places! We started with the hummus. I'm used to having it served with soft pita bread but I also enjoyed what Zaytoon served which was like a huge cracker.

I also tried the dolma which had lttle pieces of pomegranate sprinkled on the top. It was served warm which is a plus for me. I was hoping it would be cooked with tomato sauce. That is how I'm used to eating them since childhood but everywhere I have tried never serves it that way. I guess cooking them in tomato paste isn't the norm.

My main entree was a special cut of Iranian fillet mignon served with basamanti rice. The meat was nice and tender. The rice also had a pleasant taste to it. I think next time I head over there I would step out of my comfort zone and taste something new!
Love the food here classical Mediterranean version and the lamb kebabs is the best. Saam, the owner, makes you feel right at home.
I work right around the corner and my boss is constantly ordering from here. I can't blame him, everything is flavorful and priced reasonably. And the customer service is fabulous!

Excellent food and service as always! We love this place!! We frequent this establishment every week and are never disappointed in the food nor the service. They are always so accommodating and friendly. It is a pleasure to have food such a wonderful place to take friends and family.

The most amazing mediterranean restaurant in Vegas. Market and dine family restaurant . 
Great customer service extremely polite ,The services is impeccable & very clean .
Ghormeh sabzi is fantastic. It's as close as you get to homemade food. It's nice cafe for having lunch or quick bite to eat. Staff is friendly and family oriented. Keep up the good work!

Amazing restaurant the food is awesome but the service is pure 100% Persian the gentleman who served us was the owner most probably and his suggestions were on point and we were happy with every dish the egg plant (kashke bedinjan) chicken soltani felafel wrap hummus and they have voss for sparkling water!

This is one of the few Middle Eastern markets in Las Vegas. They have a nice selection of grocery items here. It is a good place to pick up the spices you will need to make Lebanese food.

They also cook Middle Eastern food here. I tried it a couple of times and it was good. They make kafta, shish kabob, chicken....etc.

This was an excellent choice for lunch!  I ordered the combination chicken and beef kabobs. The dish came with a generous portion of jasmine sprinkled with saffron rice, onion and parsley relish, and a side of fresh-baked flat bread. The food summed up; colorful, fresh, and delicious. It's located in the north end of a Mediterranean market within a strip center. I will return with guests.

We are new fans of Zaytoon! The right hand entrance is to the restaurant while the left is to the market. We browsed the spices and delicacies while waiting for our food to be ready.

The meat is flavorful and the portions are equivalent to what you pay for. My SO loves the koobideh while I prefer chicken. With the rice, I like to mix in the butter and onions, then sprinkle the sumac.

Upon entering, you'll immediately notice and appreciate the authenticity. We will be coming back!

Nothing much to complain, I will give 5 stars if was in the better location.
Server was  nice, straight to the point: I'm hungry and that's what I like to eat, and they bring to you 
Really off of the strip, but is worth it to try.
PS: they will charge you for $1 for paying with Credit Card.

Zaytoon ~ The best & the freshest Mediterranean Food in Las Vegas!!

My favorite dishes at Zaytoon:
The boneless Chicken Kabob
Yoghurt & Shallots Dip ~ Masto Musir
Koobideh Kabob (ground beef)
Barg Kabob (Fillet Mignon)
Bone in Chicken Kabob (Whole Cornish Hen)
Also, make sure you order the piping hot flat bread.  It is great with the Masto Musir!!

Honestly, everything they serve is great!!!

My family is addicted to the food of Zaytoon!!  It is really great food & the prices are so affordable!

When you go to Zaytoon, look for the owners ~ Sam & Golenaz!  They are such wonderful & hospitable people!!  They make you feel right at home like family!

http://zaytoonlasvegas.com/restaurant-menu.html

A+++++++ again. See my other reviews for details.  I noticed there is an ad for a competitor on their page here. I've been to that place. It's not worth the money and the food is not as good. Just come to Zaytoon.

luv zaytoon makes me feel like im at home! probably the only real mediterranean restaurant on the westside. they make you feel like a part of their own family. they know all the regulars and have your orders memorized.

This is my go to spot in getting my hands on saffron which is a really great ingredient to keep in the kitchen. Aside from having all sorts of wonderful spices and fresh produce here their restaurant next door serves a delicious kabob. 

For lunch or dinner, their menu is a must try. It's tasty and delicious and they have their kabobs cooked to perfection!

After having lunch in a restaurant located in the same shopping plaza, my wife and I stopped in to take a look at what this market/restaurant has to offer.  We immediately drawn to the display of baked goods that included a number of different baklavas.  We tried two - Turkish pistachio and Turkish walnut, these proved to be drier than the Greek version that we prefer.
First time I came here I was a bit scared to try Persian food . I can honestly say it was amazing !!! Now I've been here so many times and I will continue to come
The food isn't life changing- but it's good. And the service is exceptional. Based on that alone I would return.

Pretty good food !! And service was excellent! It's a family owned restaurant. So far I've tried beef kabob, chicken, and lamb. And all have been delicious. Prices aren't too bad either. Dishes range from 10.99-26$. It's a small joint, maybe about 30 people can dine in. They also have a Mediterranean market connected to the restaurant, for all your Mediterranean needs!! My new go to spot since it's in the neighborhood !! They open at 11am! And some items are halal !!!

Small place attached  to market, but don't let that fool you. The food is amazing! Had chicken soltani and beef soltani! Delicious!
The taaftun bread is homemade and to die for! The service is quick and attentive! Must eat here!  Bravo zaytoon!

Coworkers and I come here at LEAST once a week. 
Yes that is how much we enjoy it! I usually have the chicken sandwich, all the sauces combined and the tenderness in the chicken with avocado just melts in my mouth. And the service is awesome, there is a family feel to it. I definitely look forward to lunch when it comes to Zaytoons!

The baba ganoush is incredible and comes with a side of thin, warm soft bread for dipping. When we ran out our server as if we wanted more. Yes please! Really fresh tasting, very flavorful, Mediterranean food. I ordered the lamb shank which was fall-off-the bone tender.  It came with a huge plate of fava rice. My mom who has never had Mediterranean food really enjoyed her beef wrap. I ate the other half of her wrap the next day and it was delicious! Will definitely be back!

It's a family own restaurant. I love their kabobs.... Excellent customer service. Would come back. This is not a restaurant by itself but it's connected to a small supermarket. More like fast food than dine in.

Outstanding!! Real find in suburban Summerlin. The fa√ßade of the building is that of a Mediterranean market place, and the restaurant is a small part of this just to the right of the market entrance. From the moment you walk into this establishment you realize that this is a family run Business where the owners take immense pride in a clean and tidy place to relax and have a meal. Persian food is not mainstream in America, but maybe it should be. There's a lot of emphasis on fresh vegetable and meat presented in the most appealing manner. The beef and chicken kebabs were succulent and worked well with the buttered rice, broiled tomatoes and raw onions. Serving sizes are substantial and can be shared for a dollar or two extra. make sure you try some of the appetizers with the homemade fresh sesame flatbread. The yogurt and shallot "Dip" went particularly well with the kebabs. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this excellent restaurant. The service was extremely courteous and friendly, with emphasis being on Iranian hospitality! Most of the diners were Iranian which says a lot for the quality of product.

Omg, this place absolutely rocks!!  I am so in love with the food.  My husband is Persian so I have tried every Persian restaurant around.  Zaytoons is BY FAR the best.  The fried eggplant  is so yummy.  The yogurt cucumber  I've never been disappointed!

Returned here because last time the food here was awesome. Today I was greeted by a handsome gentleman who was very nice to explain some menu items. I ordered to-go and he offered fresh Persian tea. I declined it but he insisted and brought it to me anyway. The tea was amazing while I waited. The food was brought to me in less than 10 minutes fresh off the grill. I love the Persian music that they play.... This was a great experience! The food was delicious and told my entire staff about this too!

Excellent little Mediterranean market with a attached restaurant that serves up some very authentic Persian food.  Had the koobideh plate with an order of shirazi salad.  Very yum. Only reason this isn't getting 5 stars is because the service was a little frazzled. Even though there were many staff around they kind of just stood around in the back, with only one guy doing the order taking, busing, serving, etc.  hmmm just a tiny bit chaotic.
Excellent for lunch.don't expect expensive atmosphere, just good n light kebab.

This restaurant is really unique with a friendly size facility having both a restaurant and a shopping market. I absolutely appreciate the cleanliness of the store when I walked right in.

The gentleman who helped us was truly friendly and kindly asked if we were eating here or to go. Of course we had to eat here and enjoyed the music and the inviting interior.

Their menu was simple to read. Not too many items and it described what each dish contained. I ordered the Lamb Shish Kabob. I would highly recommend this dish. It was perfectly delicious and filling. 

Overall experience was tremendous. Great staff and food and I am pretty sure all their dishes are delicious!

Thank you

A hidden Las Vegas gem close to our house that we often visit. The restaurant is attached to a Mediterranean market and is no frills authentic Mediterranean dinning. The flatbreads and wraps are great and the Iranian entrees and menu options are excellent. Always reliable and delicious.

Me and my friends were trying to decide in advance where to eat for a get together and we wanted to try something new. I decided why not have kabobs! It was very fortunate that it was across a dessert place we initially planned on going to but our trip was highlighted by our dinner here at Zaytoon!
Our server took care of us and suggested the Sumac and the Chili oil because we had no idea how Persian's eat this. I copied the guy across our table and put butter in his rice! I whispered "Dude he put butter in his rice so we should too!" so we did. Then our server asked us if we wanted chili sauce. I generally do not put chili sauce on my food but since I was trying a new place, I guess why not? THEY MAKE THEIR OWN CHILI OIL! I was expecting it to taste like Lee Kum Kee. It did not. I ended up mixing my rice in Chili oil and next thing we knew. Our server showed us what Sumac is. Oh boy, I enjoyed that Sumac so much I just drizzled it on top like it was rainbow sprinkles on ice cream! I taste tested the chili oil and spices too. I had to make sure I actually made sure I was not dreaming about the flavor of their food. The food just felt homemade except for really good plating.

I told my friends I could not stop talking about my food trip today. I still talked about the food at the Custard place and in our group chat! I could not stop talking about this place to four people so I decided to share about my experience!

found this place on yelp...i had the lamb kabobs...was very tasty ,only complaint it should be two skewers for 20 not 1 skewer....other then that the owners were very friendly.As a side note there was this beautiful woman working the register that was worth a star all by itself..lol...im assuming she is married to the owner so I respectfully submit that I approve of your taste in women...I will be back was good food and welcoming attitude..although now that I made a yelp pass at the owners wife they may chase me out with pitchforks and torches haha

Best Best Best in town!
The great persian food
Don't forget to ask for their fresh baked bread.
Anytime I go to Vegas its a must going there.
The couples' owners are amazingly nice and friendly.
Customer service is 7 star! 
God Bless t
The Best Iranian Food, Ever. I've tried numerous of Iranian restaurants all over the country but this was the best. Definitely recommend!!

I am so glad I live next to this place. I am appalled it's taken me this long to stop in.

I would probably give the restaurant 3.5 stars, but the market 5, so it balances somewhere around a 4. 

The restaurant is a great neighborhood place, very cozy, very, very clean, and with a very friendly staff. Somewhere between 5 and 10 tables, and authentic in that wonderful, unpretentious way that announces their food is good, and they live here, so sit down and eat. The food is very good; we had a group, and 3 of us had the kofta, one of us had lamb. Everything was good, but not slap-yo-momma I have to order something else. The kofta started to dry out towards the end, and I sort of felt that overall, most things could use a little seasoning and salt - BUT everything came with a lovely packet of Sumac salt. It needs that. That makes everything much more lovely. Also, we licked the bottom of the Babaganoush. 

OHH!!! OH! And the Market! They have sweet lemons!!!! What, Foolish American who shops only at smiths? "Lemons are never sweet?" you say? Ah, fool that you are, you have not shopped at ethnic markets and bought things you do not know the name of. Sweet lemons are sort of like the beautiful godly love child of meyer lemons and tangerines. They are soft, and about the size of a small valencia orange. They are yellow and speckly, and sweet with a sharp tang on the finish. They make margaritas superlative. They are also awesome peeled into mandarin-esque wedges and eaten as snackies. Zaytoon HAS THEM. And about 10 other wonderful citrus and fruits you won't find at albertsons, for prices you won't find at albertsons, fresher than you will find at alberstons. Feel silly for shopping at Albertsons? You should.

Did I mention cheap pistachios?

Another good experience here today. I needed my ghormeh sabzi herbs, kidney beans, eggplant, tomatoes and onion. They had fresh produce, all shelves stocked and excellent customer service. The owner and his wife are so professional and friendly. I highly recommend Zaytoon for all of your Persian/Middle Eastern grocery needs!
The bread and yogurt dip is to die for. Great, authentic food. I come here with my Iranian friend and he raves about the authenticity. Delish food and market next door.

Excellent fresh food! Small restaurant adjacent to market and Service was great 
Will be back
We moved from LA which is known for the best persian cuisine in the US. We were looking for one and found this place which is by far the best in Vegas.

We drive quite a distance just to get the very special Persian food prepared here.  We have enjoyed many of the specials and regular dinner menus the chef presents.  Each dish had wonderful flavor and was proudly served by the server.  My husband is Iranian and claims that this restaurants dishes are as good as his mothers.  I look forward to our visits to zaytoon and so do our friends.  This unassuming little out of the way place (for us) serves dynamite healthy, freshly prepared food. 
Try it!!

I love Persian food.

We ate:
Baba ganoush was fabulous with very fresh pita
Chicken Kabob
Vegetable Kabob

All items above were tasty.  
There is also a middle eastern market attached to this very small restaurant.

Wow! Such good Persian food in Vegas??? I love this place! Friendly service, nice decor and amazing food. How can it go wrong? A family owned Persian restaurant serving quality food. Love their Kabobs! Soft, juicy and delicious. It's definitely worth stopping by here while your in Vegas.

As a Chef and someone familiar with Persian Food, we found the food bland, the servings quite small for the high prices charged. Sure, nice small market, clean place, nice people, just a couple of blocks away from us and on the good side of town, but the dishes bore little to no resemblance to the amazingly spiced, incredible tasting dishes I came to love from the best families in California. We went with great hopes of a good meal and came away disillusioned.....

I get the same entree, the chicken kabob halal with basmati rice, each time I eat here because it is always made to perfection, and the best of any I have tried in the valley. The flatbread is served warm and freshly baked. Service is quick and polite. Prices are a little high for what you get but still reasonable.

Excellent authentic Iranian Cuisine. Wonderful service, fresh ingredients, and a great selection. Try the Soltani if you are in search of a tasty, delicious entree. Wash it down with Doogh and enjoy the fresh baked bread.

I came in last week for the first time and I've been thinking about it ever since! I couldn't wait to come back! I finally tried the lamb shank. Delicious! I had the hummus again for my appetizer. I want to try the falafel and lentil soup next. Awesome service and food! I'll be back next week for lunch!

The kabobs were perfect. The rice was perfect. The service was great. I wish this place was in my town. I would be.... more broke. This is actual good quality food and I would really recommend it. One of the few restaurants that know how to do Persian Kabobs right.

Clean and welcoming restaurant attached to a small market. Very friendly service. Fresh, flavorful, juicy, and perfectly grilled food (I had the koobedeh, my husband the chicken kabob). Totally recommend the pistachio and rose ice cream. Loved it so much we bought a pint from the market attached to the restaurant among other items. Might I recommend the dried fruit bites? They're ADDICTING!!!

So I went down to Jungle Zone for some iolite love and found this place in the same spot. Went to go browse around and they have a nice selection of goods that are kinda hard to find to make Mediterranean food and in the back they have a cafe. Different canned goods, sauces, spices, bulk bins of beans, yogurts and cheeses, some fresh fruits and produce, lots of cookies and chocolate goodies. I then get to the ice cream and freak the fuck out. MASHTI MALONES ice cream. It's from Los Angeles and is a family owned shop that has exotic flavors: rose, lavender, rose saffron, mango, saffron pistachio, ginger rose, orange blossom.Yeah, it reminds me of happy happy times growing up on this stuff. I got a rose ice cream sandwich since they didnt have pints of anything but pistachio and faludeh. I also found my favorite white toblerones and other foreign goodies.

Came in today after Slider Truck, and they had all sizes of the Creamy Rose so I got their biggest size, a quart and a small cup of Pistachio. We also got gummi bears. I know, why get these at a cultural market? The mood struck and they are super soft and make me happy as I type. I didn't need any cooking ingredients at the moment, but will come and expand some of my spices and sauces when I run out of what I have. 

I'm going to keep coming back though for Mashti Malones. It's one of my favorite treats ever. Thank you Zaytoon for carrying them!

Very disappointed with there Fesenjun, being a Persian Restaurant  I was expecting it to be atleast cooked well, Rice was very bland not enough butter .Fesenjun was bog disappointment ,Kobiedieh was also not good over all I was not satisfied by the quality and taste of the food , Service was also not that great they forgot an item and called me back but that doesn't really and he didn't have to lie to me saying that they ran out to give me my order because I was next door doing grocery for few minutes, Well again Business should  value there customer's.
The food here is very tasty and authentic. A family run business with friendly service. We have been going here for years and never had any issues. The store is a great shopping experience also.

Compared to many other Persian Dine-In places, this place gets 5 stars hands down. Although their restaurant is also in a market and not really fancy, their food is out of this world good! Everything is fresh and made when you order, nothing tastes or look like it has been sitting in the back for hours. Its amazing and seriously my favorite place to go when I want persian food (especially their beef kabob).

Everytime I've gone, there has only been two people working at the store.. a man and a woman. The young man is very attentive and so nice.
When ever my boyfriend and I go in to buy some fresh Baklava, he remembers us and gets our yummy snacks ready to go quick! 

I love Zaytoons and I know I'll keeping coming back for more!

Their food was good. Best fresh bread I ever had. Prices were very reasonable. it Seems like all the family were working there. They gave me an excellent service. very kind people. I forgot to buy a bread when I was ordering my to go food. They gave me my bread and did not charge me for it.

Still solid food here....service got better though!

The staff seemed much more friendly, and more attentive than the last times I came in the past.  

Can't go wrong with the food here.  Everything we have tried here has been great.  Prices are very fair, and it is super fresh!  Really like the kabobs and rice dishes.

If you are looking for authentic food and you are nearby, give it a try and you'll agree :)

When on this side of town, I love coming here. If I'm not having my moms home made kabobs then Im here. Honestly, this is the best authentic kabobs in town!!!

I always get the bone in chicken kabob! However, I know no matter what dish I order it will be perfected. I wish they had better seating. They only have about 8 or so tables. This is one of those whole in the wall places. I've never really had to wait either so maybe the flow of customers for their tables is sufficient. Personally, speaking growing up we'd have my big birthday dinner at a kabob restaurant. Hence, many have closed down or the quality has gone down. This place would be perfect to bring that tradition back if it was bigger. There's a wall diving the seating area and Mediterranean market! It makes sense though and it's killing two birds with one stone. The appetizers are only 3.99!!! The kabob dishes are very reasonable too! There's this older man who is a server here too and he always take great care of me and mine every visit. 

You won't regret having a fresh, inexpensive authentic kabob dish here!

This is the best  Persian food hands down in Las Vegas! Fresh and delicious , have eaten here at least once a month for the last 6 years. The owners are always pleasant. Tried another place and will not ever stray again.
I order some take out for my holiday party, they very professional and the food was ready on time, My guest were happy with the food.

This cozy little restaurant is big on flavor and hospitality!  My husband and I were looking for something on the healthy side, and found this wonderful Mediterranean spot in the southwest part of Las Vegas.  

Side note: Due to the size of the restaurant, we experienced a bit of wait but were offered Persian tea for the inconvenience. We certainly appreciated their kind gesture.

Here's what we ordered:
-World Famous Hummus (that's not the official name, but it will be soon enough)
-Freshly Baked Bread 
-Lamb sandwich (sandwiched are actually wraps)
-Chicken sandwich 
-Greek, Turkish, and Iranian Baklava (I call it the baklava sampler)

Zaytoon is officially my NEW favorite Mediterranean restaurant in Las Vegas.

I had not eaten Middle Eastern food much before Zaytoon and didn't think I liked it. I thought it was exotic, maybe like Indian food--You know the kind of spicy melange where you can't even tell what it's composed of... But my predisposition could not have been further from reality, at least as far as the food at Zaytoon is concerned. Everything is straight-forward wholesomeness, mildly spiced just to accentuate the flavors of the ingredients.  My favorites are the masto musir with their hot, fresh bread, the chicken kabob with the incredible rice (delish mushed in with the grilled tomato they serve on each plate), and the shirazi salad.  They have some of the best french fries I ever tasted and their chicken kabob sandwich is made irresistible by the special sauce they put in it.

The location of the restaurant is kind of hard to find but the food is pretty good. I ordered the chicken sandwich and I really enjoyed the fresh bread that surrounds it. It's almost like a tortilla. The hummus was very excellent too. I was impressed that the chicken was very moist. I would return.

PROS: Chicken, hummus, service, and bread
CONS: Location
This place is the best can't beat it, super nice friendly staff. The girl at the front is awesome always in a great mood and really nice. The food is great cannot be beat served fresh and hot

On my last night in Vegas, I craved Persian food and found Zaytoon on Yelp. The kabob koobideh was delicious! I know I've said this in a review I did in Seattle, but the food is comparable to Reza's in Chicago (my measuring stick of all Persian food).
The hummus that accompanied the flat bread was some of the best I ever had.
Lastly, the owner was very friendly and hospitable.

I was looking everywhere  a jar of grape leaves that I could stuff on my own. I remembered this place and went in. It smelled so good in there. The man in the front was so nice and actually came out to explain each kind of grape leave that they had.

They have a nice selection of groceries and produce. If you are looking for fresh herbs, buy them here. They are SUPER cheap. The prices looked reasonable. I purchased to big jars of grape leaves and they were about $5.00 each.

I can't wait to come back and try this lace for lunch. The menu was big and looked and smelled amazing.

Its family owned small business, really a whole in the wall. The second time I dined here I was the only nonPersian eating there. Good sign that's it's pretty authentic. First time I went there is was good, second time I went there is was also good. You walk in where its half market half restaurant and just take a by seat then they bring you a menu and you order. After you order they will bring you some Persian flat bread hot out is the oven. It is so good, I can just eat that with some humus and to me that can be a complete meal. On this trip I tried the hummus and Shiraz salad both good. Also had the Chicken and koobideh combo. I enjoyed everything here and the prices are really good and unlimited bread which can fill you up. So be careful no to eat too much bread even tho it so good. 

This is the only Persian or middle eastern restaurant that I have been to that serves this unique bread, most places just give you the market crap pita bread warmed or cold which is crap.

This is the best Persian restaurant in Vegas and better than any in LA that I have been to.

Been meaning to check this place out for a while as I'm a sucker for Mediterranean cuisine in general, and because I thought it was a lot closer to my work than it ended up being.  I know, I know, there's an app for that, but sometimes I throw caution to the wind and just go for it.

I called them up for a take out order and decided on the Regular Chicken Kabob Entree and an iced tea.  I must mention that from taking my order over the phone to doing the cashier work, the gentleman who helped me was extremely friendly.  After my long drive back to the office and opening the food, I was extremely disappointed to not see any bread.  Upon looking back at the menu, I realized that it was not something which came with the entree, but rather a side that needed to be ordered.  After bashing my head against the desk for about 5 minutes due to this error, I began eating what I did have, which were some nicely cooked pieces of chicken (though not very much of it) over a HEAP of basmati rice.  On the side were several chopped up onions, and an unappetizing looking charred tomato and pepper.  I'm generally not a fan of these items from any mediterranean joint, so not docking them for that, maybe it's just me.  The chicken tasted fine, but didnt really separate itself from other places I've had the same dish.   I think I would have preferred some more char on the chicken instead of on the veggies, but it did end up very juicy which I must say was nice.   The rice tasted average to me, though I did appreciate the amount they gave.  I can't help but think that had I ordered some bread on the side (though I'd prefer it just came with some) that I might have enjoyed the whole thing more.  I definitely know for next time.

For the lack of bread with the entree, and the fact that there wasn't too much chicken in my meal, I can't say that I thought it was that great of a value.  Zaytoon definitely requires some more investigating to me, and I'll also note that my friend that I brought with me got a falafel sandwich with fries and his fries smelled and looked heavenly.  He polished them off during the drive back to work and I didnt get to try myself.   I have to wrap this review up, the picture of the fresh bread that I can see below where I type now is pissing me off.   Learn from my mistake if you call in an order and dont forget the bread!

I wanted to like this place so much! The staff were so friendly and their desserts looked so delicious. I ordered a falafel sandwich to go for lunch and the falafel were so dry! I was starving too but the dryness really killed it. The side salad was too oily.

Found this gem of a shop and kabob shop thanks to Yelp. Went two days straight before I had I leave Vegas. Some of the best Persian food I've ever had. This little store rivals some of the fancy sit-down kabob places in LA and Orange County. That says a lot. Also very friendly people here. Will definitely going back next time in town.
This is a combination grocery store and small restaurant, needless to say it's not a first date place. The restaurant side has great Persian food and wonderful desserts. I highly recommend it

Awesome customer service , very friendly welcoming owner and staff .
Nice meditation super market and very good Persian food  
I love to come here for shopping and having good food . 
Highly recommended

Each time I come to this place I'm never disappointed. It's tucked inside a market but that doesn't stop it from being crowded at times. The food is always fresh and delicious. Their baba ghanoush is nothing like I've ever had before, literally. I've been to other Mediterranean restaurants and tried theirs, it's nothing to compare to Zaytoons. My family and I order it each time we go. Their sandwiches are petite yet filling and full of flavor. The staff is always friendly and prompt. I highly recommend you try this place.

Went here for the first time and was pleasantly surprised by how good it was.  I had the Beef sandwich and the Shirazi salad instead of the fries.  Great choice.  I loved the quality of the meat and the way it was wrapped in a burrito style way.  The shirazi salad was very good.  They give a portion of the flatbread with butter to have while you wait for the food.  That was excellent as well.  My lady had the Lamb shank and it was served with white rice and some saffron rice.  That was excellent as well.

The service was very good.  The young man that was clearing the tables and bringing the bread was a little unfriendly and stand offish but the other man and lady that brought us our drinks were super friendly and asked how everything was.  The dining area was a little small but thats ok because its actually a market as well and the space constraints allow for only so much.  Over all my experience here was very good and I will be back again in the future to try something else.
Great food and service... I fly in from California and have to eat here every time... Thank you!!!

This place was highly recommended by a friend when I asked about trying Mediterranean food for the first time. From the moment I stepped inside the warm welcoming was fabulous! The staff was so helpful in going over the menu to make sure I pick something I would thoroughly enjoy! I ended up getting the chicken kabob with rice which was very tasty! The customer service by far will keep bringing me back along with the wonderful food!

This is the only persian restaurant I've been to in the vegas area. I tried this place based on yelp reviews and haven't needed to try any of the others. They are short staffed and if you go when they are busy, you may have to wait a little while. The staff are very friendly. Their fresh bread is awesome. Their yogurt with shallots is also superb (mast mosir). I have tried a few of their kabobs, but the best one in my opinion here is the koobideh (ground beef and onions). You get two skewers and rice for 9.99 What a bargain and so tasty. I've tried their chicken, fish and filet (barg) kabob, but they aren't as good as the koobideh. So I always get koobideh and mast mosir. Their shirazi salad is very good too. I have been here at least 15 times in the last few months. I am considered a very picky critic especially when it comes to food. This place delivers. The other dishes are good too, but the koobideh is amazing.

Every once in a while I stumble upon a place that just works, in every single aspect.  This place is a fine example of that.  The people that work here were simply great.  Very knowledgeable about the food, friendly, funny and caring.  Our waiter actually steered us away of a dish he didn't think we would like, which I always appreciate.  The food that we did order was simply amazing.  Very flavorful and just the right amount.  

To add a cherry on top, there is a store in the same building that specializes in Middle Eastern foods.  Rose water, pomegranate syrup and so on.  

If you are anywhere near this restaurant, you owe it to yourself to stop and have a bite to eat.

Tell me about amazing service. They treat their customers with top class service. It's a very small restaurant connected within the market. I don't know if this place is family own but seems like they got their business in place. My family comes here probably once a week. They are regulars here. This has to be the best Mediterranean cuisine in Vegas hands down. I ordered the beef kabob and oh man the meat was very juicy. To top it off I always put a lot of sumac on everything. Give this place a try, the positive reviews don't lie.

I really don't like food on vegas strip, so I usually drive out to eat. Zaytoon became one my favorites among other restaurants off the strip. If you're into Merditerranean food, definitely check this place out. It's not fancy-looking, but their Kabobs are awesome.

I ordered Chicken Kabob, Shish Kabos, and Lamb Kabob, and those were were great. Hummus and long rice were okay. Just being honest. =P Owner was really generous and friendly, adding to whole dining experience.

I highly recommend this place. You will come to like this little place off the strip.

Oh yea... raw onions were pretty spicy, so be careful with it. My friend took a big bite out of it, he paid the price for few hours. lol

An Iranian colleague told me that this place was the best and he was right. Love the kabobs and the freshly baked bread with hummus is to die for. Love this place. It's not fancy at all but the food is excellent.

Food is great, service is even better. I love the  family owned business and how the attached grocery store offers Israeli foods and goods. It's also very close to my house which makes it very convenient to walk there. I love the falafel and watermelon juice!

Only place in las vegas that i found that carries lamajune (armenian Pizza) its frozen but ill take it! Ever since Mikes Bakery shut down havent been able to find it anyplace until i found this wonderful market.Also has lots of spices and fresh halva mmmm try some.

Stopped in one night with a craving for kabobs with a friend of mine and we were instantly greeted by an extremely friendly gentleman who asked us to give him a minute to clean a table for us. The menu has a lot of options but we got hummus with oven bread to share, then I got chicken kabobs and my friend got beef kabobs. The chicken was DELICIOUS, but let me tell you... that seasoning on the beef was heavenly. Definitely going to get those beef kabobs next time I go. The kabobs are served with rice and a cooked tomato (though you can get half order of rice and a small salad instead). The food was fantastic!!

Zaytoon is half restaurant, half market. We were there close to closing time, so I didn't get to browse through the market, but you can kind of see it over the wall the separates the sides. There's not a lot of "decor" here, but they have some cutesy quotes on the wall and a TV that was playing music videos. 

Don't go here expecting a fancy meal, go here expecting some delicious food and some excellent service.

Nice Persian place--I had a mix of the chicken and beef; the chicken stood out more than the beef, better seasoned, nice and tender. Prices are reasonable. Service was friendly but not the most attentive. I'll definitely be back again.
Wow! What an awesome experience all around. They are friendly, the food fresh, tasty and amazing, and clean. Cant wait to be back to try more.

Excellent food. The food was delicious. The space is small and got crowded quickly which led to a bit slower service. But despite that, the food was authentic, delicious, and worth going back to. Highly recommended to anyone seeking a tasty and light meal.

I went to Zaytoon for the groceries, but now I need to go back for the food. There was a great selection for the small size of the store. Great service too. The woman checking me out asked if I had found everything and went and grabbed the one thing that I didn't see. I love that it is so close to my house. Will definitely be back and recommend it to friends.

Found myself craving some kabobs and rice. And found this spot on yelp.

I was definitely satisfied, I ordered the garb soltani? And the steak was honestly nothing special, a bit dry but still flavorful, though I wish the steak had a bit more of a sear to it. The koobideh was surprisingly jucier. The sumac is really good, I put that shit on everything. And use the butter they give you for the rice, it takes it to another level. The babaganoush(spelling?) was really good and smoky.

Overall it was a satisfying meal, just nothing to really write home about and the price point of $20 was a little steep for the quality of the food thus the 4 stars and not 5.

Love it here!

Came here for an early dinner.

Our restaurant is in the same building. The owner is friends of my family and I got to meet Sam the owner today. But besides the fact that my family is friends with the owner. I love the food.I decided to come here because of the yelp reviews and location near me prior to knowing my family knew the owner.
